ftbquests.chapter.4lthe_end.quest2873630: &eTip:&r You cannot use a standard &eEye of Ender&r inside an &dAncient Portal Frame
&oCollect all of the Legendary Eyes and save them for use in a &oAncient Portal Frame
ftbquests.chapter.4lthe_end.quest5099887: The Ender Dragon rests upon its lair forged outside of spacetime, located inside the void this beast exists outside of time and seems to play an important role in the balance between The Nether and The Overworld
ftbquests.chapter.4lthe_end.quest6054729: Getting to &dThe End&r might be a little different than you are used to...
In order to open The Portal,
You will need to seek out &e"The 12 Legendary Eyes"&r.
See The Chapter &d"End Progression"&r for more information.
&eTip:&r You cannot use a standard &eEye of Ender&r to locate the portal room. You must use one of &eThe Legendary Eyes!&r

&6Hint:&r Legendary Eyes do not break! But be careful not to lose one! You can purchase a "Replica Eye" once you've collected &eThe Golem Eye&r. It can be purchased from &dThe Quest Shop&r and can be used to safely locate &eThe Portal Room&r
ftbquests.chapter.4lthe_end.quest7933480: Place each &6&lLegendary Eye&r inside the &dPortal Frame
ftbquests.chapter.4lthe_end.title: <grad from=#FFF0A3 to=#F6B800 hue=true f=1.3 sp=50 uni=true>‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ&r The End
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1042: The Volcanic Sourcelink is one of the highest generating &eSourcelinks&r in &eArs Nouveau&r, using fuel items such as &eCoal&r or even &eLava Buckets&r!
If only there was a way to get infinite &eLava&r...
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1067: The Shady Wizard is a Villager job from &5Ars Nouveau&r. His main sales are &eTablets&r for the &eRitual Brazier&r and &eFamiliar Tokens&r. His Job Block is the &eArcane Core&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1163: The &eAmethyst Golem Charm&r can be obtained by using a &eRitual of Awakening&r near &eBudding Amethyst&r. It can grow and harvest &eAmethyst&r that is near its home.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1164: &5Ars Delight&r adds quite a lot of food items for you to increase your overall Spell Power and Mana Regeneration!
Some allow you to regenerate Mana as you heal like the &eMendosteen Tea&r while foods that give the Wilden effect increase your Spell Power plus more Mana and Mana Regen!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1178: The Wilden Chimera is the Boss of &5Ars Nouveau&r, and very difficult having multiple phases that imitate each of the Wilden Beasts.
The &eWilden Tribute&r is a crucial aspect in upgrading the &eMage's Spell Book&r to its final tier, the &eArchmage Spell Book&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1359: &5Ars Elemental&r introduces the Flarecannon into the family of Familiars! This Familiar will act as a sort of turret and shoot Flare projectiles at nearby enemies. The Flarecannon can be reactivated by giving it &eBlaze Powder&r or &eMagma Cream&r if defeated.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1364: &5Ars Nouveau&r introduces &eWarp Scrolls&r, which allow you to set a location to teleport to at a later time using Shift + Right Click.

You can also place a Nether Portal frame made with any &eSourcestone&r blocks and throw the set &eWarp Scroll&r into the frame to create a permanent portal to that exact location, given it has Source nearby to keep the portal activated each time it's used.
&6Tip:&r &eStabilized Warp Scrolls&r skip the manual portal frame placement.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1405: &5Ars Additions&r introduces the &eSource Spawner&r, which allows you to make a small Mob farm if you give it a nearby Source Jar, as well as a &eContainment Jar&r that has an Entity inside of it.
The amount of Source that's required varies between mobs, so it's best to have quite a bit of Source ready just in case. But don't worry, it won't work on bosses!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1552: The &eTablet of Summon Wilden&r allows you to summon a random amount of the different Wilden Beasts: the Stalker, the Guardian, and Hunter.

There's no method to influence to spawn one specific Wilden Beast but if you throw a &eWilden Spike&r, &eWilden Horn&r, and &eWilden Wing&r onto the Ritual Brazier after inserting this Tablet, you best be prepared for a fight!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1632: &5Ars Nouveau&r is a very useful Magic mod that allows you to create custom spells using different &eGlyphs&r that affect how your spell works.
There are three different &eSpell Book&r Tiers, along with three different tiers of &eGlyphs&r that allow you to do a lot with just a &eSpell Book&r in hand!
&5Ars Nouveau&r has many features other than just spell casting!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1713: &5Ars Nouveau&r has three basic armor sets that are upgraded from Vanilla's armor sets: &eGold Armor&r to Sorceror, &eIron Armor&r to Arcanist, and &eDiamond Armor&r to Battlemage.
These armor sets give you a boost to Maximum Mana and Mana Regen and allows armor to repair itself with Mana.
&eMagebloom fibers&r are important for allowing this upgrade to happen with the &eEnchanting Apparatus&r and can be obtained by making a &eMagebloom Seed&r and growing it to harvest &eMagebloom&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest1814: The &eTablet of Scrying&r allows you to find just about anything and everything, but the most usage comes from finding those hard to find ores such as &eCrystallized Ender Shard Ore&r from the End, or &eAncient Debris&r!
You MUST have the Ore itself in order to Scry for it, meaning you must have already used Silk Touch on an Ore to use it in the &eRitual Brazier&r.
The effect lasts no time at all, but if you add a &eManipulation Essence&r with the Ore, the Effect duration is increased to 15 minutes!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest2693: &eSource Links&r are essential for generating Source in &5Ars Nouveau&r. There are a variety to use, some being better than others in most cases..
&eSource Relays&r can be connected to &eSourcelinks&r with a &eDominion Wand&r in order to send Source across varying distances.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest2712: &5Ars Ocultas&r bridges the gap between &5Occultism&r and &5Ars Nouveau&r by allowing the Djinns from &5Occultism&r in &eContainment Jars&r to continue their work!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3060: Placing the tool on a &eScribe's Table&r and Shift + Right Clicking with a Spell from your &eSpell Book&r with no Form Glyph will inscribe the current spell onto the &eEnchanter's Tool&r.

Each one comes with a pre-determined Form Glyph depending on which tool you use. There's too much information to explain here so I'd recommend checking the &eWorn Notebook&r to learn more about these awesome items!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3071: &eEnchanted Spell Turrets&r cost imbued spells at half the cost of the regular amount of Source required.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3100: &5Ars Nouveau&r has a very extensive list of features and items, ranging from simple to complex. Having a &eWorn Notebook&r will allow you to learn about every item possible in the base mod, including the addons such as &5Ars Elemental&r and &5Ars Ocultas&r, which is the bridge between &5Ars Nouveau&r and &5Occultism&r!
&6Tip:&r The &eWorn Notebook&r can also be accessed on the left side of your &eSpell Book&r UI.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3301: Both &5Ars Nouveau&r and &5Ars Elemental&r add a plethora of magical equipment for you to create and use. The most basic items are the &eRing of Discount&r, &eAmulet of Mana Boost&r and &eAmulet of Mana Regen&r.
If you find yourself carrying or needing a lot of these items, feel free to craft the &eTrinkets Pouch&r for easier access using the "J" Keybind!
Check your &eWorn Notebook&r or the documentation in your &eSpellbook&r to view them all!
Amulet of Mana Boost or Regen
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3496: &eTimer Spell Turrets&r cast the imbued spell on a short interval in seconds. Right Clicking will increase the time, while Left Clicking will decrease the time. Setting it to 0 or giving it a redstone signal will disable the timer.
You can lock this turret with a &eDominion Wand&r to lock it in order to prevent the timer from being changed!
It will also cast spells that have Projectile, Touch, and Redstone for free!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3523: The &eStarbuncle Token&r is obtained by giving a wild Starbuncle a &eGold Nugget&r. The Starbuncle will collect &eSource Berries&r and place them into chests that are assigned to them.
Starbuncles can also move items between chests, making it the cutest hopper in the world! They also have a &eWheel&r for &5Create&r that they love a lot!
&6Tip:&r Giving them &eStarbuncle Shades&r stops them from collecting &eSource Berries&r, but it makes them look cool, right? You can also give them a &eWixie Hat&r to transport potions!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3577: The &eAdjustable Spell Turret&r is a small upgrade from the Basic Spell Turret&e. You can change the direction it's facing with a &eDominion Wand&r by Right Clicking the desired block.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3696: A &eDrygmy Token&r is obtained by giving a Wild Drygmy a &eWilden Horn&r. Right clicking a &eMossy Cobblestone&r block with one or more Drygmy Charms will generate items from mobs in nearby &eContainment Jars&r if a chest touching the &eDrygmy Hedge&r and constant stream of Source is provided.
&6Tip:&r The more&e Containment Jars&r that have unique mobs nearby, the "happier" the Drygmys will be and generate items a little faster.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest3983: The &eWixie Token&r is obtained by using Dispel on a Witch at less than half health. Right clicking a &eCauldron&r, the Wixie will automatically create a single potion type out of materials in a nearby chest and nearby Source.
Right Clicking the &eWixie Cauldron&r will tell the Wixie what potion to make. She will always make 3 potions worth in the &ePotion Jar&r, and it can hold a lot of potions!
&6Tip:&r In order to fully automate potions, multiple Wixies are needed.
She's not a wicked witch, right?
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4001: The &eAlchemical Sourcelink&r generates source from nearby &eBrewing Stands&r, as well as nearby &ePotion Jars&r. It's most effective when consuming complex Potions with multiple steps.
&6Tip:&r Using Wixies, this can be automated very efficiently.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4040: &5Ars Elemental&r adds four different armor sets and they are the pinnacle of Elemental Mastery.
Each armor has its own special full set bonus that corresponds with the four elements: Water, Earth, Fire, and Air.
For example, the &eAethermancer&r armor allows you to take reduced fall damage, while the &eGeomancer&r armor satiates you while you're underground.
NOW You are a true Mage!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4333: The &eVitalic Sourcelink&r generates source by using the essence of slain mobs nearby, as well as Baby Animals as they are growing and speeding up their growth in the process.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4401: &5Ars Nouveau&r introduces &eThreads&r for your armor that are separate from tiered upgrades. There's a variety of &eThreads&r that are helpful in many ways, and some even stack on top of Vanilla enchantments like &eRespiration&r and &eFeather Falling&r!
Your armor has quite a few slots available at the max Tier, but you may only have one of each &eThread&r in your entire armor set, so choose wisely!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4523: &5Ars Nouveau&r rituals enable you to do quite a few things as mentioned in the previous quest, but there's a lot more to it than that....
In the following quests, I'll be explaining a variety of the most common rituals and the best way to use them!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4602: The &eTablet of Containment&r allows you to place entities inside of a &eContainment Jar&r.
But be careful because any entity will be placed inside of the &eContainment Jar&r, and I mean ANY entity, even arrows that have been shot from bows or random items on the ground!

&6Tip:&r Having a 'Touch - Dispel' spell on hand will remove whatever is in the &eContainment Jar&r, so don't worry if you capture the wrong thing! Just don't put your &eSpell Book&r in it accidentally.....
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest4685: The &eMark of Mastery&r from &5Ars Elemental&r is necessary in upgrading the basic &5Ars Nouveau&r Armor into an Armor set focused in a single Element.
The &eMark of Mastery&r requires a lot of Source to be crafted as well, so make sure to have plenty in stock!
There are four different elements for Armor: Water, Earth, Fire, and Air.
Each Armor Set has their own effects that make them unique from each other.
&6Tip:&r None of the &eEssences&r will be consumed if crafted using the &eImbuement Chamber&r, only the &eWilden Tribute&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest5000: &5Ars Nouveau&r has many familiars that can be summoned with &eCharms&r in order to automate certain aspects, such as &eSource Berry&r gathering, creating potions, or even generating items from enemies in the form of a Mob Farm.
The &eDominion Wand&r allows linking these familiars to their corresponding work stations, as well as linking &eSourcelinks&r to &eSource Relays&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest5092: The &eMage's Spell Book&r is a large upgrade to the &eNovice's Spell Book&r, allowing access to Tier 2 Glyphs and better Spell combinations.
&6Tip:&r Unlocking more &eGlyphs&r gives a large boost to Maximum Mana and unlocking ALL &eGlyphs&r will reward you with around 1500 &lextra&r Maximum Mana!
Was I not a Mage before?
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest5130: The &eSource Relay: Splitter&r is capable of sending Source to multiple &eSource Jars&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest5554: The &eSource Relay: Warper&r can transport Source over seemingly infinite distance, with the cost of losing some Source in the process.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest5592: These &eElemental Infused Turrets&r are a lot stronger than the other Turrets!

They can cast spells at a 65%% discount, as well as performing spell combos that would be used in combination with the variety of &eElemental Focuses&r that &5Ars Elemental&r provides for you to use yourself!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest5987: The &eBookwyrm Charm&r is obtained by using a &eBook And Quill&r on a &eRitual of Awakening&r and must be linked with the &eStorage Lectern&r using a &eDominion Wand&r in order to connect chests into one unified storage block. One Bookwyrm is able to connect up to 8 Chests.

&6Tip:&r &5Ars Additions&r adds the &eWarp Index&r that lets you have remote access to the &eStorage Lectern&r with infinite range as long as the chunks are loaded, while the &eStabilized Warp Index&r allows for cross-dimension access.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6366: The &eRitual Brazier&r allows you to manipulate the space around you, such as summoning animals, changing the Time of day, or even allowing constant flight.
Most Rituals require an income of Source in order to function while some don't require Source at all.
I-Is it supposed to do that?
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6428: The default Keybind for opening the &eSpell Book&r is "C". This will give you access to the &eSpell Book's&r UI in order to view unlocked &eGlyphs&r, as well as creating spell combinations.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6697: &5Ars Nouveau&r adds multiple Essences, with &5Ars Elemental&r introducing the &eAnima Essence&r to the mix. These are important and require quite a bit of Source to be created efficiently.
Essences are needed for crafting most &eGlyphs&r at a &eScribe's Table&r, as well as creating the &eMark of Mastery&r in the &eImbuement Chamber&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6704: The &eRitual of Awakening&r is used for a few things such as creating Guards for your base out of Archwood trees, and creating &eBookwyrm Charms&r and Amethyst Golems!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6760: The &eArchmage's Spell Book&r is the final tier of Spell Book for &5Ars Nouveau&r, allowing for even more powerful spell combinations and unlocks access to Tier 3 &eGlyphs&r.
&6Tip:&r You can find Crystallized Ender using the Ritual of Scrying!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6774: Combining any &eSpell Book&r with a dye allows you to change the color of it, as well as your armor with the exception of &5Ars Elemental&r armor. Try making it red as a test and then find your own favorite color!
In addition to changing the color of your &eSpell Book&r, you can also change the color of spell projectiles on the left side of your &eSpell Book&r UI!
&6Tip: &rMost customization is found on the left side of your Spell Book UI, such as projectile sounds and summoning Familiars. A built-in &eWorn Notebook&r is also provided as well.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6777: The &eMycelial Sourcelink&r generates source by consuming Food items. The higher the nutrition that a food item gives, the more Source that is generated from it.
Tip: &eSource Berries&r give more Source than food items such as &eBread&r or &eCooked Potatoes&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6873: The &eSource Relay: Collector&r will collect Source from &eSource Jars&r in a short radius around it.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest6934: The &eAgronomic Sourcelink&r generates source from surrounding crops in a 15x15 area.
&6Tip:&r The crops must be actively growing in order to generate source. Crops that are full grown will not generate source, &obut there are exceptions to this rule.&r
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest7053: The &eDominion Wand&r allows you to link Familiars to their corresponding work stations or other necessary blocks, as well as linking &eSourcelinks&r with &eSource Relays&r.

The most common method to linking is a simple Right Click but you may have to Shift + Right Click when dealing with chests or other storages. Another Shift + Right Click clears the links from the targeted block.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest7081: Familiars in &5Ars Nouveau&r and &5Ars Elemental&r have uses outside of their corresponding work stations. The Bookwyrm for example will collect items and XP Orbs for you, while the Wixie can boost the duration of &ePotions&r!

Each Familiar has a unique role to play, whether it be combat or exploration. Use your &eWorn Notebook&r to learn more about what they can do for you! They can also be accessed in your &eSpell Book&r at any time!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest7137: The &eScribe's Table&r allows the creation of &eGlyphs&r at the cost of some resources and XP. Right Clicking the &eScribe's Table&r with a &eSpell Book&r will open the UI. In order to craft a spell, throw the necessary items near it.
&6Tip:&r The &eScribe's Table&r can pull resources from nearby chests, eliminating the need to throw items manually.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest7699: The &eSource Relay&r is the most basic Relay in &5Ars Nouveau&r, only being capable of sending Source from a Sourcelink to a single &eSource Jar&r.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest8091: &eSource Gems&r are the fundamentals of &5Ars Nouveau&r, needed to craft many items such as the variety of &eEssences&r.
&eSource Gems&r can be created using either &eAmethyst Shards&r or &eLapis Lazuli&r. When crafting items, the &eImbuement Chamber&r does not consume resources in nearby &eArcane Pedestals&r.
&6Tip:&r &eImbuement Chambers&r can be semi-automated with certain methods to make this process easier.
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest8316: The &eTablet of Locate Structure&r allows you to find a select few Vanilla structures such as an End City or a Bastion.
It can also be used to search for the illusive Arcane Library for all your &5Ars Nouveau&r needs!
ftbquests.chapter.6ars_nouveau.quest8386: The &eEnchanting Apparatus&r is the other core crafting part of &5Ars Nouveau&r, allowing for the creation of a plethora of items, such as upgrading basic armor into something better suited for Spell Casting.

ftbquests.chapter.6nvampirism__vampire.q: The Vampire Forest biome can only be found in a unique vampire pocket dimension, this dimension can be accessed from a portal.

ftbquests.chapter.6storage_solutions.que: A &6Master Corporea Spark&r is the core of any Corporea network, one simply cannot function without it.

It can be placed on any block which can accept a Corporea Spark, but will not provide the contents of that block to the network, for this reason, many users of Corporea networks will often place it upon...
The &6Corporea Index&r, the device used to &dRequest Items from the Corporea network manually&r!
To use the Index, place it down and connect it to the Corporea network by placing a (Master) Corporea Spark on it, then &duse your &bGame Chat&d to type out and send item's name&r.
When requesting by name, the current name of an item is compared, so &dany renamed items will need to be requested by their new name&r!
Corporea requests have a form of Expressions that can be used, so typing out entire item names all the time isn't as necessary.
Additionally, the &6Corporea Request&r Keybind can be used within GUIs to &drequest the item that is currently being hovered over&r, this can work in JEI too!
Requested 1 x "Existence" out of 1. 1 taken
The Index and the Master
The Iron Chest is an example of an upgraded type of basic chest! There are many more to craft!
&8Note:&r These do &nnot&r work with &dCloud Storage
Craft an &eIron Chest
As I'm sure you've noticed, there are a &olot&r of items in MC Eternal!
Thus, you'll want to learn about all of the awesome ways to store your trash and your treasure!

The most notable mods to watch out for are &dCloud Storage&r which lets you send your items up into the cloud (&oliterally!&r) and &dSophisticated Storage&r which adds all sorts of upgraded chests and barrels, perfect for storing large quantities of items!
They are even upgradable!
Read Me!
&eInfo Quest&r: Storage Solutions!
The final step is connecting your &eStorage&r and &eTerminal&r to form your &bStorage Network&r.
&eLogic Cables&r are the medium in which everything flows, and &eInterfaces&r are the way to introduce external objects into your &eNetwork&r.

With that, we've built our &bStorage Network&r, but that's not the end for &dIntegrated Dynamics&r; It specilizes in doing &avery specific tasks that it's alternatives might not be able to&r through &eVariable Cards&r and their &9extensive permissions&r.
You can being exploring more by interacting with &eImport/Export Interfaces&r.
The Nerves
Cables
The &eDrying Basin&r can be used for more than just drying &eMenril Blocks&r.
Moving forward we are going to need &eMenril Glass&r; A single piece will do, but use this as a moment to explore it alternative uses.
&6Hint:&r Try placing &eGlass&r within an Drying Basin, &ebefore&r adding in some Menril Resin.
Crafting Material or Building Block?
In order to access your &bStorage Network&r and work with all that it contains, an &eCrafting Terminal&r is needed.
The Brains
&eVariable Cards&r are your way of &acommunicating to your machines&r what you want to do and how you want to do them.
But we aren't going to make use of them yet in this chapter, outside of crafting recipes.
Though that doesn't mean you can't experiment and explore their potential yourself.
Instructing your Network

The &6Corporea Automation Blocks&r are all very powerful devices, capable of more deeply integrating a Corporea network with Automation, opening many possibilities, such as &dOn-Demand Autocrafting!&r
Additionally, it can read the count of items in the stored request in a nearly identical way to the &bCorporea Crystal Cube&r.
Using these devices, you can take your Corporea network to the next level!
&6See the following pages for details on each!

The &6Corporea Funnel&r is the simplest of the bunch, capable of requesting items from the network automatically, simply place an &bItem Frame&r on it, and slot in the item you want it to request, then when given a &cRedstone Signal&r, it will request that item!
The Rotation of the item in the frame will determine how many items are requested, doubling with each rotation except the last two (where it increases by 16 instead), up to 64.
Items requested by a Corporea Funnel will either be dropped in the world ontop of it, or &dadded to a Container placed below it.&r
The &6Corporea Interceptor&r is a bit more interesting, if a Request is unable to be completely fulfilled, by there being a shortage of items, it will emit a &cRedstone Pulse&r!

You can use this property to do many things, such as start up an automated mechanism to craft more of an item when it runs out, or create a &cRedstone&r system activated by a Password input to your Corporea network!

Now then, the &6Corporea Retainer&r is a strange one, unlike the other two, it doesn't connect to a Corporea network directly, rather, it connects to a &bCorporea Interceptor&r, and &dstores the information of the last request the Interceptor was activated by&r, it can then &b"Replay"&r the request from where it was originally made, when provided with a &cRedstone signal&r.
Integration by Parts
&oAny Corporea Automation Device
Automation with Corporea
&eBalloon Pieces&r drop from &eBalloons&r which spawn high up in the sky!
&6Hint:&r If you are having no luck with mob spawns, I've heard The Goblin Trader occasionally sells &eBalloon Pieces!

Don't let It Burst Your Balloon!
Securing and maintaining an constant source of &7Power&r for an &bStorage Network&r can be troubling, but what if you didn't need any?
Introducing &dIntegrated Dynamics&r, an mod that relies on &eCrystallized Menril Chunks&r for the purposes of &eConnecting&r, &eReading&r and &eTransporting&r inventories.
&6Tip:&r If you get your hands on &64x Glowstone Dust&r, before entering &4Expert Mode&r, &dIntegrated Dynamics&r is an efficient use of them for an &bearly Storage Network&r.
Integrated Dynamics
&eThe Cloud Chest&r is the most important block in the mod, it acts as your central "hub".
You will interact with your Cloud Chest to access items!
Cloud blocks can be found in the sky and also drop from the &dBloviator&r mob!
&6Hint:&r Just like the &eBalloon Piece&r, if you run into problems finding the mob, The Goblin Trader can sometimes sell &eClouds!
&8AWS or Azure? ü•Å
Craft a &eCloud Chest
The Cloud!
In order to send items into the cloud, you must first place a &eChest&r
Every chest with a balloon attached that safely makes it into the sky will have its items added to your Cloud Chest&r
&6Hint:&r Balloons can be popped midair!
To ensure your items are safe and not griefed by monsters or other players.
It is wise to send up empty chests and access your Cloud Chest&r directly to store items!
Then attach a &dBalloon&r to the chest and watch it soar!
Your Cloud Chest is exclusive to you! So no need to worry about thieves!
It is worth mentioning that your &eCloud Chest&r is linked to the colour balloon you pick.
You can dye your balloon multiple colours to get a unique colour!
This will let you have multiple Cloud Chests!
Every chest you send up into the sky will add storage space to your Cloud Chest&r
Just make sure to attach a balloon of the same colour to your Cloud Chest&r
&dRight-Click&r with a Balloon to pair it to the cloud!

Oh Don't Mind Me! Just Popping By!
&dCorporea&r is an &6Item Request system&r in Botania, &oprimarily&r able to &6retreive Items from Containers connected to it&r and provide them to a Player, or to Automated systems.
Designed to be heavily integrated with &cRedstone&r mechanics, it is a simple, yet very capable system, despite how few components it has.
In &5MC Eternal 2&r, the basic parts of the Corporea system have been made available much earlier in the game, though some specific things will be unlocked later on instead.
An Incorporeal system
Corporea
Strange Crystals capable of exchanging information with others of their kind, used in the creation of some Corporea devices.
The Material and The Immaterial
Corporeality Crystals

&6Corporea Crystal Cubes&r are a Corporea device capable of monitoring the amount of an Item visible to a Corporea network, aswell as allowing a Player to withdraw that item from the Cube by &dPunching it&r.
&dSneaking and Punching&r will withdraw up to a stack.
To set the item, simply &dInteract&r with the Crystal Cube while holding it.
Interacting with a &6Wand of the Forest&r on a Crystal Cube will &dLock&r it, preventing its item from being changed until unlocked.
They can also be read by &cRedstone Comparators&r, and will increase the &dOutput signal's strength by 1 every time the number of items in the network doubles.&r
For example, only 1 item will result in a Signal Strength of 1, 2 will result as strength of 2, 4 will result in a strength of 3, 8 will result in a strength of 4, etc.

ftbquests.chapter.advanced_mekanism.ques: Indulge your inner creeper with this custom-made induction matrix! You can create a one-of-a-kind centerpiece using a mix of basic and ultimate blocks.
Whether you need to store or transfer power, you can easily customize your matrix to fit your needs‚Äîfrom a small 3x3x4 to a massive 18x18x18.
Experience the power of lithium! Pump it into the chemical crystallizer for dust that can be used to craft induction cells and providers, giving you access to supreme storable energy.
Want to get the most out of your liquid lithium? Decondensentrate it to proceed further!
Want to go one step further in the thermal evaporation process? Feed your brine into this plant and get liquid lithium, an essential component for your induction matrix!

&eTip:&r Scurries in dark places. Surprisingly resilient for such a small pest.
&eTip:&r Found in the sparse jungles. Uses venom and stealth to ambush prey.
&eTip:&r Small but mighty! Known for the fastest punch in the warm ocean.

&eTip:&r Deep sea phantom of the void, it wrestles whales where no light dares reach.
&eTip:&r Tiny desert hopper with huge ears and bigger energy.
&eTip:&r Horned tank of the Savanna, don‚Äôt stand between it and its charge.

ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest122463296: The &6Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate&r, used to forge &aTerrasteel&r using large amounts of &bMana&r.
To operate it, simply drop the ingredient items &dontop of the Plate, or Interact with the plate while holding them&r.
Note that it can only forge one item at a time, and if the process is interrupted, &call &bMana&c it has consumed so far is lost!&r

Unless you want a difficult challenge, you'll need to place a &6Spark&r ontop of both the Plate and any nearby &bMana Pools&r you want to use Mana from, the items on the plate can despawn, and a few &bMana Spreaders&r will not provide Mana to the plate anywhere near fast enough.
&6&oRequired to make Corporea Automation Devices in MCE2!
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest123744298: The Ritual of Gaia is used to summon the &bGuardian of Gaia&r, a powerful Avatar of the Earth itself.
In order to summon it, the Beacon in the ritual setup must be active, and a &aTerrasteel Ingot&r must be sacrificed by &dSneaking and Interacting&r with the Beacon.
&oConstruct the setup for the Ritual of Gaia
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest308070038: &6Rosa Arcana&r will consume &bExperience&r from &dnearby Players or Experience Orbs&r to generate &bMana&r.
They are also able to &ddisenchant items like a &bGrindstone&r in to generate Mana from the experience that
It produces somewhat more Mana when extracting from a player, but having to sit there for your Mana production to work sucks.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest367752769: &6Munchdews&r produce &bMana&r by eating up &bLeaves&r in a large area around them.
However, no items will drop from Leaves it consumes.
After consuming all leaves in range, it will go on cooldown for a while.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest399564661: &6Thermalillies&r suck up nearby &bLava&r and run for some time, producing a considerable amount of &bMana&r in the process.
However, they will then go on a long cooldown with some randomness to its length.
Unlike other Flora, they aren't really intended to be automated.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest413671051: &6Shulk Me Nots&r create considerable amounts of &bMana&r when a &bShulker's Projectile&r collides with a &cHostile mob&r.
Both the Shulker that fired the projectile and the hit Mob must be within in the Shulk Me Not's range, and will be killed when the projectile hits.
&eHint:&r Getting ahold of Shulkers for it sounds tricky, perhaps a Botanical avenue offers a means using a resource from The End?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest488112467: The &6Floral Obidence Stick&r can be used to quickly bind all nearby &dFunctional&r or &dGenerating&r Flora to the &bMana Pool&r or &bMana Spreader&r the stick was used on.
Handy if you're working with a lot of flowers and didn't place the target first, or want to bind them to one pool over another.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest508804734: The &6Wand of the Forest&r is a botanist's equivalent to a Wrench, used to configure many botanical blocks and flowers.
Simply holding it in your hand will display a &bMana&r bar when looking at a block that holds Mana, showing its capacity, along with how much it currently has.
Its most common use is to &dBind&r some botanical devices to other blocks.
To do such, &dSneak and Interact with the device while holding the Wand, and then do the same on the target block.&r
Binding is used to connect &dFunctional and Generating Flora&r to &bMana Pools&r or &bMana Spreaders&r respectively, aswell as aim Mana Spreaders at blocks, and set targets for some other devices.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest514164780: The &6Kekimurus&r chomps on nearby &bCakes&r to produce &bMana&r.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest600772814: &6Entropinnyums&r absorb explosions from TNT (and sometimes similar Explosives) to generate &bMana&r.
They generate a significant amount of Mana, but they must be entirely emptied to absorb an explosion, otherwise they won't absorb it at all, and you should know how that goes...

ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest696260986: &bMana&r, the fundamental energy used by Botanists.
In order to produce it, you'll need some sort of Flower that can generate it from other things
&cMana is not produced passively&r, it is something that &aGenerating Flora&r must actively consume things to produce.
When placed, Generating Flora will automatically attempt to bind to the nearest &6Mana Spreader&r within binding range.
You can manually &dBind&r them after placement using a &6Wand of the Forest&r by &dSneaking and Interacting&r on the Flower, and then the desired Mana Spreader.
As for firing Mana from Mana Spreaders into a &6Mana Pool&r, &dSneak and Interact&r with the Spreader while holding a Wand of the Forest, and then the block you want it to target.

Opening the Portal requires 1/5th of a &bMana Pool&r's maximum capacity, split between all Pools within &d5 Blocks&r of the Gateway Core which have &bNatura Pylons&r directly ontop of them.

ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest733219394: The &6Rafflowsia&r generates &bMana&r by &dconsuming other Flora placed near it&r.

You might think that sounds terrible, and it starts that way, and has diminishing returns if you keep giving it the same Flora over and over, but every &dunique Flora fed to it in a row causes it to make exponentially more Mana&r, and it makes a &lLOT&r of Mana at high Streak values.
It will also forget the least recently consumed Flora when it reaches the maximum Streak, so you can keep the chain going indefinitely with a proper setup.
Even though some Flora can't be automated, the limit for its Streak doesn't account for those Flora.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest787537197: From Botania's About section on Curseforge
- Provide pleasing visuals, despite using only two different particle effects.
&6&lBotania's goals&r
- Break the mold of mods being means to ends-- be engaging in gameplay as well as in rewards;
- Deliver fun and balanced gameplay without forcing players to grind;
- Incentivize sandbox gameplay and allow players to create fun contraptions;
- Create an overall immersive experience.
Difficulty: &6‚òÜ‚òÜ&r
Cost: &6‚òÜ&r
Strength: &6‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ&r
&9https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/botania &r

&o&b&lBotania&r&o is a tech mod themed around natural magic. Gameplay is centered around creating magical flowers and devices using Mana, the power of the earth. Botania is fully playable as a standalone mod (and is designed as such), but it functions just well in conjunction with other mods.
The mod focuses on automation, but without elements that make it feel grindy-- systems can be thought out and designed, rather than built blindly from blueprints in JEI or a wiki.&r
&6&lBotania's design philosophy&r
- No pipes, wires, etc-- they're boring and overdone;
- No GUIs-- interact with everything in-world;
- No numbers-- players shouldn't try to minmax everything;
- Keep all resources as renewable as possible;
Introduction to Magical Botany
Lexica Botania

ftbquests.chapter.complicated_bees.quest: Some species of &6bee&r, when bred with others, will result in a brand-new species of &6bee&r! Generally these &6bees&r show as hybrids with one of the parent species, but occasionally you might get lucky and find a purebred mutation.

When an offspring &amutates&r, one whole chromosome (half of a &6bees&r genetic structure) is completely replaced with the result species' 'pure' chromosome. This means you might get some spontaneous generation of new traits - new &6bee&r effects, temperature tolerances, work speeds, and more.
Carefully breed these &amutated&r &6bees&r with your current genetic stock to get more! Keep in mind that some species are recessive, and will take more effort to breed true.

The Apid Library allows you to examine &6bees&r in your possession and determine whether they can mutate into new species. Simply place a bee in the top right slot and select a mutation on the left (if any) to see more information about it.
It'll only show the icon of &6bees&r you've already collected. It'll leave hints about unknown &6bees&r by hovering over the question mark symbol!
The analyzer lets you examine a bee's genes in-depth, as well as seeing its inactive genes; no more sneaky recessive traits ruining your ideal crossbreed!

Once made, use it to open up the analyzer interface. You'll have to place a bee in the bee slot and some honey drops in the other slot to pacify the bee and analyze it. Once you do, the bee's whole genome will be shown to you. You can see its active and inactive genes, whether a specific gene is dominant or recessive, some very special flavor text, and more!
Use this information and Punnett squares to direct your crossbreeding efforts, and create the ultimate bee!
Working as a &6beekeeper&r sure gets you hungry!
&dAmbrosia&r is a very useful food as it gives you multiple buffs keeping you fresh and healthy! Upon eating &dAmbrosia&r you gain Regenation 2, Jump Boost 3 and Absorption 2!

&6The Bee Sorter&r is able to classify and sort &6bees&r that get piped into it. It can accept items from any side, taking them into its single-slot buffer, and will automatically output that item to any sides that have filters configured to match the item.
Interact with the block to open the GUI. Each side of the block has a color on it, which correspond to rows in the GUI.

On the left, you have type filters - click these to swap between drone, princess, queen, &6any bee, non-bee&r, and no items allowed. The remaining six slots on each row are species filters, where 0 is the primary and 1 is the secondary. You can set these by left or right clicking on the slot with a &6bee&r or dragging one from a recipe browser.

A side is selected based on how specific the filter is; for example, the bee sorter configured here will output any Forest-Plains drones to the white side, other drones with Forest as the primary species to the black side, and any other drones will be split randomly between the red and blue sides.
By default, the sorter auto-exports - &4you can disable this with redstone&r.

You'll quickly realize you have more &ehoney&r than you know what to do with. While food is all good and well, you can also burn your excess &ehoney&r (and certain other &6bee&r products) in the &eHoney&r Generator for more RF!

Frames are consumable 'upgrades' for your apiaries! Each one has a different effect when slotted into an apiary, from increasing production to outright changing environmental conditions for the bees inside it. Frames will slowly take damage as they are used, necessitating replacement every so often. Mix and match to achieve your ideal set of bonuses!
Every &6bee&r lifecycle tick, the Temperature Unit has a chance to consume specific items to increase or decrease the temperature of the Mellarium - check your JEI for possible fuels.
Complicated bee nests can spawn pretty much anywhere - In the &2jungle&r, in the &6desert&r, &8underground&r and even in The &4Nether&r and The &dEnd&r!
Once you find one just use the scoop to break a &6bee nest&r, and you'll get a princess, a couple drones, and maybe even a comb or two!
Find a Bee Nest And Break It With a Scoop

How do you get the &ehoney&r out of combs? It's a little too sticky to manually dig out of the combs cleanly, and you have MUCH better things to do with your time, I'm sure. Enter the Centrifuge: this machine will spin things really, really fast, separating them by density - in this case, your combs into &ehoney&r, wax, and other potential extra things.

However, this spinning needs something with a little more oomph than some hot air from burning things. This is where a Furnace Generator comes in - by taking hot air from burning things, you can generate RF! (or as others like to call it, Redstone Flux)
Just put a furnace generator next to a centrifuge, give it some fuel, and you'll have your centrifuge up and running in no time!
Most combs produce &e honey&r and wax, which have their uses - some combs, though, will produce special resources in addition to those.
Craft a Centrifuge and a Furnace Generator

Now that you have &6bees&r, you'll want to set them up in a house of their own, so they can start producing that sweet, sweet, &ehoney&r! An apiary is ideally suited to this task - with easily-accessible space for &6bees&r, frames, and products, this wonderful little block is a beekeeper's (or, if you're feeling fancy, an apiarist's) best friend!

Once you've located a good spot to set up shop, just plop down your apiary and place your princess in the top slot and a drone in the bottom, and you're off to the races! A princess and drone combine into a queen, which will produce combs if fully satisfied. If the bar on the left turns red, just hover over it to see what else the queen needs to be satisfied.

Now that you have a queen content with her surroundings, she'll slowly produce combs and (eventually) die, leaving behind a princess and some drones. Start the cycle all over again, and you have (theoretically) infinite&e honey&r!
The &2Mutator&r consumes one catalyst every time a queen dies to increase the chance of it producing &2mutated offspring&r - check JEI for possible catalysts.
Using the power of a &9heart of the sea&r, the Rain Shield protects &6bees&r from inclement weather!
Frame Housings can hold frames based on their tier - the basic can hold one, the regular two, and the large three. &aThese frames will stack multiplicatively!&r

&eThe Apiarist's Clothes&r can be equipped to lessen the negative effects of Bees (such as Poison from &2Tropical Bees&r). The more pieces of clothing you wear, the more often will Bees leave you alone. but they can still sometimes poison you, but that is &4very rare&r.
Craft a full set of Apiarist's Clothes
By placing &2Propolis&r in the centrifuge you'll have a change at getting a Silk Wisp!
9 of these Silk Wisps can be used to craft a Woven Mesh!
3 of these Silk Wisps can be used to craft a piece of string!
Collect enough Silk Wisps to make a Woven Mesh

Every &6bee&r lifecycle tick, the Hydroregulator has a chance to consume specific items to increase or decrease the humidity of the Mellarium, with a chance of producing a leftover - Check your JEI for said info.
Throughout your &6beekeeping&r journey you'll have to collect lots of resources such as the one marked above!
Each resource being useful in many ways - Here's how to collect these essential resources!
&eHoney Droplets&r and &eBeewax&r are produces as a by-product of every &ehoneycombs&r by placing them in a centrifuge!

&2Propolis&r and &dRoyal Jelly&r are a by-product from different &ehoneycombs&r so you'll have to cross-breed to get these! By placing the &ehoneycombs&r in a centrifudge you'll have a change at said products!
&aPollen&r are by-products from 2 certain &6bees&r by making them work in the apiary!

The Mellarium is an industrially-sized apiary, capable of housing special modules that can kick your production into high gear. It provides a &abaseline 1.25x multiplier&r to productivity which can be increased through modules.
Note that non-base mellarium blocks can not be placed in the top layer of the Mellarium.
To build it, place down a &a3x3x3 cube of mellarium blocks&r. If you've done it right, the cube will assemble like so:
&4Try not to build these across chunk borders or right next to each other.&r

The microscope is an invaluable tool for researching specimens. Place a &6bee&r in the top right slot to begin analyzing it - you'll be presented with a minigame you'll have to complete. The difficulty of the minigame is based on how complex the species is: the further into the mutation tree, the more complex a species.

To help you complete the minigame, you can place extra &6bees&r of any type or royal jelly into the highlighted slots below the specimen. These items are then consumed when you click the arrow to provide hints towards the game - the more complex a specimen, the more bees it takes to get a hint.

Once you complete the minigame, you'll research a random mutation involving the specimen's primary species. Researching a mutation grants apiaries placed by you a flat +20%% chance for the mutation to occur within them.

&6Bees&r need specific conditions to work in, which vary by species - generally, &6bees&r prefer to work in environments similar to the ones they are native to; for example, a Jungle &6bee&r would prefer a hot and humid environment. You can use a meter to measure the temperature and humidity of the surrounding areas.

&6Bees&r also need specific 'flowers' nearby, which tend to be plants native to whatever biomes the bees are native to. Azaleas, vines, dead shrubs, even skulls - all of these and more are potentially flowers that your species of &6bee&r might need.
Breaking a &6bees nest&r without a scoop will result in you getting &4stung&r in retaliation for destroying their homes.

All values of a gene (called &b'alleles'&r) are either dominant or recessive, shown in the analyzer as red or blue. When two different alleles are present within a &6bees&r genotype, a dominant &ballele&r will be active over a recessive allele.

This means to have a recessive &ballele&r be active in a &6bee&r, you have to breed in such a way that produces two recessive alleles within a &6bee&r. When there are two alleles that are both dominant or both recessive, the active &ballele&r is randomly chosen.

With enough bees producing combs, especially at an industrial scale, you'll want to start making your machines better. Ever-useful propolis and some other materials will make special modules that you can use to upgrade your machines! All machine upgrades stack multiplicatively, just like frames.

With your &bCPU&r online, you now need some &bRAM&r to work with.
2) &bCrafting Network&r checks that you have enough &eCrafting Storage&r to hold all the required materials to fulfil the order.
3) &bCrafting Network&r sends the order to the available &ePattern Provider&r containing the &eRequest's Pattern&r

4) &ePattern Provider&r informs the adjacent &eMolecular Assemblers&r of the &eRequest&r and provides the necessary materials from the connected &bStorage Network&r and the &ePattern&r's instructions.
5) &ePattern Provider&r enters a "sleep" phase were it awaits the expected outputs, while the &eMolecular Assembler&r works on crafting and returning them.
6) Once all the requested "crafts" are completed and recived by the &ePattern Provider&r, the operation is completed and the products are sent into your connected &bStorage Network&r.
&6Tip:&r For Automatic Crafting, the speed at which a &eRequest&r is resolved can be improved by placing more &eMolecular Assemblers&r adjacent to your &ePattern Providers&r.
&6Note:&r Only &ePattern Providers&r and &eCo-Proccessing Units&r require &eChannels&r.
&6Note:&r When using &ePattern Providers&r for functions outside of crafting, the same process applies with the &aappropriate functioning blocks&r.
(&6Visual Example&r; &5Fluix Cables&r are hidden but connect the &bCrafting Network&r with the &bStorage Network&r)

While &eCo-Proccessing Units&r and &eCrafting Storage&r determines the amount of &eRequests&r you can issue and the number of items that can flow around your &eCrafting Network&r at a time; &eRequests&r can not be fulfilled without the appropriate &eME Pattern Providers&r and &eMolecular Assemblers&r.
&eMolecular Assemblers&r are &eAutomated Crafting Tables&r, they can hold a &ePattern&r and automatically craft it's item as long as it receives power and the resources required.
For useage in your &bCrafting Network&r they basically do the same thing, but instead of needing a held &ePattern&r and inputted resources, adjacent &ePattern Providers&r can provide both.
&ePattern Providers&r store all your &ePatterns&r and order around the adjacent blocks based on the &eRequests&r contained within their &ePatterns&r.
They can accept &ePatterns&r manually by rightclicking and inserting Patterns, or indirectly the use of a &eME Pattern Access Terminal&r that is connected to your &bCrafting Network&r.
Once your &ePatterns&r are contained within your &eNetwork&r, and you access it using a &eTerminal&r the option to "craft" your items will appear.
When you make a "craft" &eRequest&r using your &eTerminal&r, a few things happen;
1) &bCrafting Network&r checks that you have a &eCo-Proccessing Units&r avilable to order the "craft".

&bCrafting Network&rs are a multi-block and have two parts, the &bCPU&r and the &bRAM&r (Metaphorically).

The &bCPU&r contains the &eCo-Proccessing Unit&r and &eCrafting Storage&r, they control how many &eRequests&r you can make at a time, and how many &eItems can be flowing around&r in the &bCrafting Network&r at the same time, respectfully.
They can be placed anywhere adjacent to each other, and expanded by just adding more of the required block.
Initially one of each a &eCo-Proccessing Unit&r and a &e1k Crafting Storage&r is plenty, but as your demand expands upgrading the appropriate bottleneck is important and simple.

If you are requesting a lot of &e*Unique Patterns*&r at once, then you need more &eCo-Proccessing Units&r and if you are requesting a lot of a &e*Single Pattern*&r then you need more &eCrafting Storages&r.
&6For Example;&r Crafting 30 different types of doors => &eUnique Patterns&r, Crafting a single type of door 30 times => &eSingle Pattern&r.

Budding Certus Quartz is the source of all Certus Quartz Clusters, and is intended method of sustaining your supply of Certus Quartz.
They can be found in 4 stages: &bFlawless&r, &eFlawed&r, &eChipped&r and &eDamaged&r.

When harvested through &4*barbaric*&r means and when sprouting Certus Quartz Clusters; &eBudding Certus Quartz degrade&r in the following order: &bFlawless&r -> &eFlawed&r -> &eChipped&r -> &eDamaged&r -> Certus Quartz Block

&6Tip:&r &bFlawless Budding Certus Quartz&r do not deteriorate after sprouting Clusters and as such make for an &eeasy self-sustaining source of Quartz&r, But, They can not be acquired through direct methods such as mining, &eeven when using Silk Touch&r, instead you must find some other way to preserve it's quality.

&eME Interface&r acts like a 9 slot wide &eMediating Storage&r, it can fill and empty itself to and from the &bStorage Network&r based on the &eStock Options&r you setup.
It's very useful when &eSub-Networking&r and can be used as an &eAuto-Refilling Chest&r when placed between a farm and your &bStorage Network&r.
Check the &eGuide&r for more information on it's many unique interactions if it interests you.
Flat Storage?

Incase you have an already existing storage system or aren't prepared to move everything into your &bStorage Network&r, &eStorage Buses&r allows you to convert the inventory it's connected to into part of your &bStorage Network&r.

&6Tip:&r If you have a lot of &eNon-Stacking Items&r such as enchanted books and still want to access them through your &eTerminal&r, try creating a seperate storage such as &eSimple Storage Chests&r or &eCreate's Vault&r deticated to those items and connecting it to your network using the storage bus.

&6Hint:&r &eStorage Buses&r are useful for many cases, so many infact that I couldn't reasonably fit them all here, but if you ever find yourself trying to access resources between your &bStorage Network&r and a &eSub-Network&r, &eStorage Buses&r are can help.
&6Tip:&r By default, &eStorage Buses&r allow everything to move through them, but they can also be filtered to only accept certain resources.
This can be useful when harvesting &eCertus Quartz Buds&r by filtering the bus to only accept &eCertus Quartz&r which can only be produced by &eMature Certus Quartz Buds&r.
Therefore your harvester of choice, assuming it doesn't have it's own inventory, will only be able to harvest &eMature Certus Quartz&r ensuring that you do not run into inefficent harvesting.

90%% of the time when you need something &eAutomated&r, a &eSub-Network&r can usally solve it.
As soon as you &aget an inital grasp on the fundementals&r you'll fly through learning the rest of &dApplied Energistics&r in no time.
Keep in mind that a lot of the information provided is usally &anot the only solution&r to the problems they solve.
&6Here's some basics;&r
-When setting up a &eSub-Network&r, the &5Fluix Cables&r connected to your &bPrimary Network&r have two functions; &7Providing Power&r and &eImporting/Exporting&r.
--&7Providing Power&r is easy using Quartz Fibers, by placing it within a &5Fluix Cable&r it prevents it from connecting your &bStorage/Crafting Network&r while still allowing &7Power&r to flow.

--That same &5Fluix Cable&r can be used to &eImport/Export&r, by introducing a &eMediating Storage&r, such as a barrel for &eItems&r or a tank for &eFluids/Gases&r, and connecting to the &ePrimary Network&r using an &eImport Bus Filtered&r with the items your operations need, and an &eExport Bus Filtered&r with the outputs that you've produced.
*Don't forget to use a &eStorage Bus&r/&eMe Interface&r as your &eSub-Network&r needs a way to access the &eMediating Storage&r*

&eImport Bus&r on the left of the barrel to recive output, &eExport Bus&r on the top of the barrel to provide resources, &eStorage Bus&r on the front of the barrel allowing &eSub-Network&r access into Mediating Storage, &7Quartz Fiber&r on the only connecting &5Fluix Cable&r between the &eSub-Network&r and &bPrimary Network&r to provide &7Power&r.

It sounds overwhealming but I assure you it is manageable, a little bit of messing around in order to understand how each of the mentioned technologies interact and you will start to get the hang of it.
Ofcourse, &anever shy away from looking up videos&r in order to understand what things should look like and how they should be operating.

Your &dME Controller&r is the heart of your entire Network, every machine you have used so far takes up a &eChannel&r, without a controller your &eNetwork&r is limited to &e8 Channels&r.

While &e8 Channels&r is enough for early applications of &dApplied Energistics&r, as your operations begin to scale that amount will seem like nothing, and that's where your &dME Controller&r comes into play; Each of it's 6 faces provides &332 Channels&r.

If you haven't already, try right clicking your &dME Controller&r; It will provide you with an overwheleming amount of infromation, but once you understand what it all means it won't look so scary anymore.

Your &eNetwork&r details tell you a lot of things, the amount of &eChannels&r you have used, your &7Stored/Max Power&r, your &ePassive Drain&r which we will get to in a moment, and your &7Energy Useage/Generation&r.

While most of these are fundamental, &ePassive Drain&r is a bit more unique, most machines you connect to your system will have a minor amount of &ePassive Drain&r, but it's nothing to worry about as long as you have a power setup appropriate for your scale and you have a suitable &7Power Bank&r.

The &7Power Bank&r of your &dME Controller&r alone is insuffecent, since it cannot store a meaninful excess of energy. With &76k AE (energy)&r storage provided by your controller, you have no buffer for when multiple machine begin running. The solution? a &eEnergy Cell&r, with it's weakest iteration providing &7200k AE (energy)&r storage, a single copy will be a sufficient buffer for a long time.

One of &dApplied Energistics&r' most popular uses is it's &bStorage Network&r, a method of transferring all of your items into the digital world, it's much simpler to use and expand than you expectations may have you believe.
There is another mechanic to &eStorage Cells&r related to &7Types&r; &7Bytes&r work in such a way that the &7Capacity&r of a cell is used more efficently the less &7Types&r it uses.
This is most useful when &eModifying Cells&r and shifting around &ePriorities&r which will be explained soon.
Again, the specifics aren't necessary but the &eGuide&r has a table can explain this visually. (Try holding 'G' on &eStorage Cells&r)
All of your &4*spoils of conquest*&r will be stored in &eME Item Storage Cells&r, functionally a chest with much deeper item slots.
&eStorage Cells&r are stored in &eME Drives&r which act as a holding bay for &510 Storage Cells&r per &eME Drive&r regardles of size or type.
To access your &bStorage Network&r you must use at least a &eME Terminal&r, but for most cases you want to push a step beyond and instead use a &eCrafting Terminal&r.
Not only does it allow you to access your &bStorage Network&r but it also provides an easy to use &eCrafting Table&r within the terminal.

While all &eItem Storage Cells&r only allow you to store &563 types&r of items per Storage Cell, the size of your &eStorage Cell&r (&c1k&r, &64k&r, &a16k&r etc.) allows you to scale the &7Capacity&r of those cells.

Basically, you &4do not&r want to store &enon-stacking items&r such as Swords, Armor and the various Trinkets you come across inside your &bStorage Network&r; else you risk overflowing the &7Types&r of items that you can store much earlier than the &7Capacity&r of your cells.
Before moving on, it's important to note that the &7Capacity&r of cells is not in terms of items but in terms of &7Bytes&r.
They are hard to explain and a deeper understanding of them isn't required but fundamentally &ethe more&r &7Bytes&r &eyou have, the more Items you can store.&r

The &eCell Workbench&r allows you to &aAdd/Remove/Config&r &eUpgrade Cards&r from your &eStorage Cells&r and/or &ePartition&r them.
Here's an example; Say you have a Cobblestone Generator and you want to pipe it into your &bStorage Network&r.
But wait, you don't want to end up filling all of your &eStorage Cards&r with Cobblestone. What do you do?
&6Hint:&r Before you turn the page and check the answer, think of the &eUpgrade Cards&r we've introduced, could any of them achieve this task?

You could install an &aOverflow Destruction Card&r onto a &eStorage Cell&r, but before you do that you must make sure that the &eStorage Cell&r will only accept Cobblestone otherwise you risk your &bStorage Network&r eating your items. But how do we do that?

&aPartitioning&r, by placing a &eStorage Cell&r into your &eCell Workbench&r you gain the ability to &ePartition&r it's cells; This means that by placing a copy of the item(s) you want the cell to contain, you can make it exclusively accept only those items.

So now, if you have &aPartitioned&r your &eStorage Cell&r to only accept Cobblestone, &eModified&r it with an &aOverflow Destruction Card&r and set the &epriority&r of the &eME Drive&r containing it to the top of your &aChain of Priority&r, any and all Cobblestone &eImported&r into the &bStorage Network&r will fill the &eStorage Cell&r to it's &7Capacity&r and the excess will be thrown into the void instead of overflowing your &bStorage Network&r.
&6Hint:&r If you already have Cobblestone in your &bStorage Network&r, try using the &eME IO Port&r to move it all into your new &eStorage Cell&r.

Part of why &dApplied Energistics'&r &bStorage Network&r is so popular is it's ability to &eRequest&r the automated crafting of &9*any/everything*&r.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eCrafting Table&r, &eCrafting Patterns&r are used.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eSmelting/Brewing/Processing&r, &eProcessing Patterns&r are used.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eSmithing Table&r, &eSmithing Table Patterns&r are used.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eStone Cutter&r, &eStone Cutting Patterns&r are used.

&6Note:&r There are options for allowing/preventing &eSubstitutions&r, thease determine weather different blocks that could still fullfil the recipe (such as &eSpruce Planks&r making a chest instead of &eOak Planks&r) are permitted.
As you would expect, the &eCrafting&r, &eSmithing&r and &eStone Cutting Patterns&r are used for their respective blocks but &eProcessing Patterns&r are more unique.
Processing Patterns are special because your &eOutput&r is not restricted by your operating block.
This difference is what gives the opportunity for &eBrewing&r and other &aspecial operations to take place&r.
How that can be done is related to the nature of our &bCrafting Network&r and &ahow it operates&r, which we will get into shortly.
But for now lets focus on &eAutomated Crafting&r.
This is done through the useage of &ePatterns&r, "guides" for you machines on how to Craft, Smelt, Brew and so on.
Before we get to building your crafter's &bCPU&r, it's important to learn and understand how &ePatterns&r, their creation and their implementation works.
To begin, a &eME Pattern Encoding Terminal&r is required, it is how you can interact with a configure &eBlank Patterns&r.
When opening the terminal, you will notice that it displaces your &bStorage Network&r and the &ePattern Encoding UI&r, while it may look like it it doesn't actually work as a crafting table.
Instead it is a medium for you to insert the recipes you wish to automate and adjust their results if need be.
&6Tip:&r In order to familiarize yourself with the &ePattern Encoding Terminal&r, try and create the appropriate &ePattern&r for crafting Planks from Logs, then Planks into Sticks.
&6Hint:&r if you need to change the quantity Inputed/Outputed you can &eMiddle Mouse&r the respective item within a pattern to adjust it.

Regardless of weather or not you followed the tip, you might have noticed that on the right side of the &ePattern Enconding UI&r there are 4 options to choose from. Each of the options are there to explain to your &bCrafting Network&r what the expected &eOutput&r is for your given &eInput&r.

Priority is simple, the device with the higher &ePriority Value&r gets to go first.
What does this look like?
Imagine you have two &eME Drives&r, and for whatever reason you want one to be completely filled before the other begins to accept items.

By setting the &ePriority Value&r of the first to 1, or any value larger than the second drive's &ePriority Value&r, your &eNetwork&r will send all aplicable items to the first &eME Drive&r as long as it has room.
Once it is full, your &eNetwork&r will look to fill the next &eME Drive&r down the &aChain of Priority&r.
&6Hint:&r This is not limited to just ME Drives, almost every machine you work with will have an option for priority and they will all follow the &aChain of Priority&r.
