Install an axe and shears, feed it mob parts, silicon, and a little power,
and it‚Äôll craft the organic circuits your future machines crave
&6Warning:&r Tools lose durability. Please keep your fingers outside the working area.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest260195587: A delicate fusion of metal and mind. The Soul Binder is capable of merging organic essence with inorganic matter.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest276528321: Raw energy is useless if you can‚Äôt control it.
The Basic Capacitor Bank gives your power a place to rest. A steady reserve between your generators and machines.
It stores energy, balances loads, and even connects with others
to form larger banks for industrial-scale setups.
Think of it as your base‚Äôs first real power grid.
After all, even progress needs a little downtime to recharge.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest293905579: Refined materials and improved conductors bring your solar setup to the next level.
It‚Äôs the perfect mid-tier upgrade for any tech-savvy engineer who prefers brilliance over combustion.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest419390173: Forbidden fusion of machinery and soulcraft.
Feed it energy, attach a bound Soul Vial, and let your factory pulse with the rhythm of rebirth.
Some call it innovation - others call it playing god.
&oHarness life itself ‚Äî with a little help from Create.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest463816038: The Alloy Smelter hungers once more. This time for the essence of the Nether.
Glowstone dust, soul sand, redstone, and a bit of courage are all you need to bend reality into new forms.
Soularium carries whispers of the beyond, while Energetic and Vibrant alloys pulse with life and light.
Each ingot hums faintly, as if aware of its own creation.
Just don‚Äôt stare too long... &4<shake>some say they stare back.&r
&oForged in Flame, Touched by the Nether
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest491451965: You‚Äôve learned to store power - now it‚Äôs time to <rainb><wave>upgrade.
The Advanced Capacitor Bank doesn‚Äôt just hold more energy, it delivers it faster, cleaner, and more reliably.
Perfect for powering multiple machines or feeding larger production setups without bottlenecks.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest547287222: It starts simple - copper and redstone, a spark and a dream.
The Alloy Smelter merges metals, dusts, and a touch of chaos into materials no furnace could imagine.
From humble Copper Alloys to Pulsating and Conductive blends,
each fusion brings you one step closer to mastering EnderIO‚Äôs mysterious metallurgy.
Don‚Äôt forget your SAG Mill - Silicon is the unsung hero in this recipe symphony.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest602433904: Eight layers of pure, unfiltered energy storage!!! The Octadic Capacitor is EnderIO‚Äôs final word in ‚Äúmaybe we went too far.‚Äù
It supercharges your machines to absurd levels of efficiency, though side effects may include glowing walls and mild power addiction.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest637770732: To create life, one must first capture its essence. The Soul Vial allows you to safely store the consciousness
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest644161551: Behold the Conduit - EnderIO‚Äôs answer to ‚Äúwhy not everything at once?‚Äù
Energy, items, fluids‚Ä¶ &l&oall&r&r squeezed into a single block.
It‚Äôs clean, efficient, and will absolutely make your base look like a sci-fi noodle factory.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest658731602: Every great machine starts somewhere and usually with a small metal can full of questionable energy.
The Basic Capacitor might not power a city, but it‚Äôll keep your first EnderIO machines humming happily instead of sulking in silence.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest688036383: Who said magic and machinery can‚Äôt mix?
The Enchanter is where redstone logic meets arcane knowledge - infusing books with raw power and just a hint of forbidden science.
Feed it materials, lapis, and a touch of XP to craft enchantments
from the mundane to the bizarre.
From Repellent to Auto Smelt, your gear will never be the same again.
&6Just be careful&r - &oteleporting your boss away mid-fight tends to ruin the mood.&r
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest699188066: Light bedrock on fire and listen for the universe to sneeze out tiny Grains of Infinity.
Hold flint off-hand and deepslate main-hand, then sneak‚Äìright-click obsidian (or crying obsidian) or a grindstone to scrape out early grains. Mind the sparks and the existential dust.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest748715991: You‚Äôve mastered energy - now you command light itself.
The Vibrant Photovoltaic Module is the pinnacle of solar efficiency, drawing raw brilliance from the sky and channeling it flawlessly.
No fuel, no noise, no limits - &e<wave>just pure radiant power.&r
&oWhen the Sun Itself Powers Your Dreams
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest778081038: The pinnacle of power storage. Refined alloys, pulsating energy, and unmatched capacity - the Vibrant Capacitor Bank is as efficient as it is elegant.
With a massive internal buffer and rapid transfer rates, this unit doesn‚Äôt just hold energy - it &b&l<shake>commands&r&r it.
Stack multiple banks together to create your own glowing power core, and watch your base pulse with limitless potential.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest796473659: A curious fusion of magnetism and automation.
The Vacuum Chest pulls in nearby items with unseen force, saving you from chasing drops across the factory floor.
It‚Äôs quiet, efficient, and slightly unsettling - because who really knows &l&owhere&r the void keeps its treasures?
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest821445104: The XP Vacuum harvests raw experience before it fades, drawing in every last drop of knowledge from fallen foes.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest835055417: The Wired Charger converts stored energy into a usable form, reviving drained equipment and restoring your tools to full &lpower&r.
Simply connect it to your power network and watch your items light back up, ready for action.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest865271455: Every empire of machines starts with a humble flame.
The Stirling Generator takes what once fueled your furnace
and turns it into something far greater... usable power.
Coal, charcoal, wood‚Ä¶ anything that burns will keep your network alive.
It may not be flashy, but it‚Äôs reliable - and reliability is the first step toward automation.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest866753123: Why burn fuel when the sun gives energy for free?
The Energetic Photovoltaic Module turns daylight into usable power: clean, quiet, and always ready when skies are clear.
Its output may be modest, but every great power grid starts small.
Just make sure nothing blocks its view of the sky.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.quest992991333: Before you can build the fancy EnderIO machines, you‚Äôll need to get your hands dirty... literally.
Grind some coal into Powdered Coal using flint, obsidian, or a grindstone. Yes, by hand. Welcome to early automation.
Once you‚Äôve got enough, throw it into your Alloy Smelter with iron and obsidian to forge Dark Steel.
It‚Äôs tough, efficient, and looks suspiciously like it‚Äôs judging your setup.
ftbquests.chapter.enderio.title: &7EnderIO
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest1: Spawn 8 flowers by pollinating flowers with Pollen Puff
&6Hint:&r Throw the Pollen Puff at placed flowers
&6Bumblezone&r armor can be found in structures all across the dimension, with the exception of the &eFlower Headwear&r, which can also be crafted!

When held in the offhand, the &aEssence of Life&r will quickly grow nearby crops and plants. It can also heal nearby pets of the wielder as well as allies, and anything healed will also be cured of Poison and Wither effects.
Kill the Ender Dragon while wearing a full set of Bee Armor

The &aGreen Sempiternal Sanctum's&r event contains two platforms, one empty and one with a Rootmin. You need to get on the platform that is empty and hit the Rootmin's attacks back at it. This requires good timing. I should probably also mention that it can hit your armor off of you, but do not worry as your armor will not despawn if hit off by the Rootmin, but if you plan to not step off the platform to get your armor then you should come prepared with good healing.
It can get rather dark in &6The Bumblezone&r, so if possible, you may want to get some form of &9Night Vision&r if you plan on being here for a while.
The &9Blue Sempiternal Sanctum's&r event has you face off against Drowned, Guardians, and Elder Guardians in a watery arena.
The &eBuzzing Briefcase&r is a must-have for any bee handler. It can hold up to 14 bees and allow you to do things such as heal bees, reattach stingers, or grow babies up to adults.
As the &eBeehemoth&r and &dBee Queen&r are too large, they cannot fit inside the briefcase.
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest2: The first step in your quest, craft and use the &eHoney Compass&r to locate the &eCell Maze&r.
Can also be used to track the location of a &eBeehive&r or &eBee Nest&r.

To get out of &6The Bumblezone&r, you'll need to either dig straight up or down until you find &eBeehive Beeswax&r, and just a few blocks past that you will either fall out or climb out of &6the dimension&r.
Throw and hit 24 entities with Pollen Puff (Other players count)
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest3: The &cRed Sempiternal Sanctum's&r event has you face off against many different types of mobs such as Ghasts, Ravagers, Piglins, Hoglins, and more.
Fire 32 Bee Stingers from Bows or Crossbows

When held in the offhand, the &9Essence of Calming&r will make most mobs no longer get angry at the wielder. The effect is lost if the player is attacked by a mob or attacks a mob, and the item's power will deplete rapidly when sprinting
Feed a bee something honey-related like Honey Bottles or Bee Bread 24 times
You can feed the same bee all 24 times
Kill a Wither with a Stinger Spear

When held in the offhand, the &fEssence of Continuity&r, upon taking lethal damage, will instead teleport you back to your last saved respawn point with full health and hunger, all neutral and negative status effects removed, fall distance reset, and fire removed with all your items and XP.
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest4: &eBeehemoths&r are very helpful, allowing you to fly around &6The Bumblezone&r safely for a relatively low cost. To tame them, you must feed them one of a few foods. This includes &dRoyal Jelly&r, &eBee Bread&r, &eHoney Buckets&r or &eBottles&r, and even &eHoneyed Apples&r!

Once tamed, you will see a friendship meter appear above the &eBeehemoth&r. It can either go up or down depending on what you do. It can be increased by feeding it any of the previously mentioned foods or by riding it around. It will go down if the &eBeehemoth&r takes damage, with each point of damage being one friendship point lost. It will go down three times more if you dealt the damage.
At max friendship, it will become a &eQueen Beehemoth&r and move around at its max speed.
This compass will point you in the direction of the structure the &dBee Queen&r resides in, the &eThrone Pillar&r!

The &fWhite Sempiternal Sanctum's&r event has you face off against 6 Cosmic Crystals, which have a variety of attacks. The attacks are relatively easy to predict, therefore easy to dodge, but you should probably still stay more on the safe side instead of trying to attack all the time. I recommend this due to the fact that several of the attacks disregard your armor entirely.
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest5: &dRoyal Jelly Bottles&r can be obtained either from completing any of the 16 &dQueen's Desire&r advancements or very rarely as loot from certain structures.
It can be traded with the &dBee Queen&r for high-end items from other dimensions.
Kill 32 Spiders (Cave Spiders do not count)
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest6: The &5Purple Sempiternal Sanctum's&r event has you dodge spikes that come out of the ground. They are small and deal no damage for a couple seconds before becoming full size and dealing a decent bit of damage along with poisoning you.
When held in the offhand, the &5Essence of Knowing&r highlights all nearby living entities, chests, spawners, and suspicious blocks.
The &eStinger Spear&r has high attack speed but low base damage, but it can be supplemented with enchants. It can take both sword and trident enchants.

The &eBee Cannon&r can hold up to 3 bees, and when fired the bees don't get mad at you! Instead, if looking at a non-bee entity before firing, the bees will attack that entity after being shot out. Can be enchanted with crossbow enchants.
The &eCrystal Cannon&r functions similarly to the &eBee Cannon&r except it uses &eHoney Crystal Shards&r instead of bees as ammunition. Can be enchanted with crossbow enchants.
All 3 weapons can either be crafted or found in structures across the dimension.

The &eYellow Sempiternal Sanctum's&r event has you go through hoops around the arena. A new one spawns after going through the previous one, and you get faster and jump higher the more hoops you go through. Vexes will also spawn albeit quite a bit faster than you gain speed and jump height.
&dEssence of the Bees&r is a semi-endgame &6Bumblezone&r item that grants several effects when consumed.
The most important for progression is the ability to locate &dSempiternal Sanctums&r using compasses found inside certain structures and complete the events inside them.
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest7: &bProtection of the Hive&r is an effect from &6The Bumblezone&r that makes bees no longer get angry at you, which can be very helpful for exploring the &eCell Maze&r. It can also prevent you from getting &cCurse of the Hive&r one time in exchange for the effect. It has a chance to be obtained by feeding &eBees&r, &eBeehemoths&r, or &eHoneycomb Brood Blocks&r honey-based foods.

&cCurse of the Hive&r is another effect from &6The Bumblezone&r that makes bees angry at you no matter what. It is obtained by attacking &eBees&r or &dThe Bee Queen&r, or destroying &eHoney Blocks&r or &eHoneycomb Brood Blocks&r. It does not get applied when destroying &eHoneycomb&r or &eHoney Crystal&r blocks!
"Why would they curse you and protect you at the same time?"

When in the offhand, the &eEssence of Radiance&r, when you are directly exposed to sunlight (no blocks above head), will slowly repair your armor and grant you the effects Regeneration 1, Speed 1, Saturation 1, Resistance 2, and Haste 2.
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest8: Trade with the Bee Queen 128 times
In the &eCell Maze&r, you are likely here for one item in particular, the &eHoney Compass - Throne Pillar!&r
You may however find other items here from &eThe Bumblezone&r such as tools, weapons, armor, or even compasses to other structures!
Bee warned, however, as entering the &eCell Maze&r without the &bProtection of the Hive&r effect will cause you to gain the &cCurse of the Hive&r effect.
Enter &6The Bumblezone&r by throwing an &eEnder Pearl&r at a &eBeehive&r or &eBee Nest&r or pushing yourself in with a &ePiston&r.

When held in the offhand, the &cEssence of Raging&r highlights nearby mobs and upon killing one, you gain a bit of strength. The more highlighted mobs you kill in a row, the more strength you get, maxing out at 7 kills, at which point the streak will reset upon hitting a mob. The streak may also reset if you take too long in between kills.
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.quest9: This is where the &dBee Queen&r resides, and where your true quest begins.
After trading with the &dQueen&r at least once (a list of items used to trade may be found in JEI, easiest would be Honeycomb Blocks), you unlock the &dQueen's Desire&r Advancement Line.
Save 12 Bees by putting their stingers back on
&6Hint:&r Right-Click a bee with no stinger while holding a Bee Stinger
ftbquests.chapter.ethe_bumblezone.title: <grad from=#FFF0A3 to=#F6B800 hue=true f=1.3 sp=50 uni=true>‚òÜ &rThe Bumblezone
ftbquests.chapter.etitles.quest683131339: Titles are unique cosmetic rewards that can be used to show off your progress. Try to collect them all!
They earned by completing Quests, Advancements, Challenges, Collecting Title Fragments and more!

This item is fairly rare so keep it safe!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest1631: When the full set is on, you'll receive protection levels which are between leather and chain. It also provides bonus damage protection from projectiles such as arrows. This makes it an adequate temporary set of armor to survive your first night.
How To Survive The First Night! &e(Part I Armor)
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest1873: It has been a full hour! In order to progress and unlock Questing you must sign the contract!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest1981: The Brazier can be used to form a special &nmultiblock!&r Some say it can even ward off the undead!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2160: Upon walking into a village with the &c&lBad Omen&r effect

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2255: The Theater is a naturally generating structure you can find in the roofed forest biome. The audience in the theater can be made up of Pillagers, Vindicators, the occasional Witch, and if you‚Äôre lucky, an Illusioner might come to watch.

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2256: &6Hint:&r The Turtle Armor gives its wearer increased speed in water and projectile protection at the cost of slowness on land!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2370: &oHave you ever wanted to display your most proud achievements?

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2435: The Mini-Map and World-Map are very useful for navigation!
You can access the &6World-Map&r by &epressing M.&r &6The Mini-Map&r will appear at the &eTop-Right&r of the screen, you will be able to view the world and see where you've been automatically!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2580: As a Dwarf, you have a certain affinity for mining and digging..
&eI'M A DWARF AND I'M DIGGING A HOLE.. DIGGY DIGGY HOLE I'M DIGGING A HOLE! &r&7You sing to yourself... This song was huge with the Dwarven youth.. about 10 years ago.. gosh you feel old..

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2632: It is of &n&outmost importance&r to claim the chunks where you occupy a residence. Claimed chunks disallow mobs and players from griefing inside your land.
Only members&r currently in your team are allowed to break and interact with blocks.
Simply hold &dRight-Click&r and drag across the grid to claim chunks!

&6Hint:&r You can use /sethome and /home to teleport back!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2673: The &eClipboard&r can be used to easily keep an organised todo list!

&6&lHint:&r As a Pureblood, you will start as a Level 2 Vampire!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2772: &oVillage Sign-Posts can be found within a few hundred blocks of a Village. These will guide you in the general direction of a Village.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2804: &oThe Bounty Board can be found sometimes at Villages. Here you can accept Bounties and complete tasks to earn loot proportional to the Bounty Difficulty
&6Hint:&r Each bounty has a timer to complete the tasks! After it expires you cannot complete it!
New bounties will appear in the bounty board over time!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2841: Why did you milk that creeper? What possessed you to do that?
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2847: Press &d(R)&r to Roll! You cannot Dodge while mid-air or in water! A well timed Combat Roll can be the difference between life and death!

&6Tip: &rYou can unlock more &dCombat Roll Charges&r by unlocking &eExpert Mode&r and &eMaster Mode!
&7Combat Roll Charges can be found at the Bottom-Right of your Hotbar!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2929: The Goblin Trader is a curious little fellow, they sometimes approach Players in caves or underground! They offer all sorts of trades! These trades change each time you find them!
&eBe approached by a Goblin Trader &o(what an honor)
&eBe approached by a Goblin Trader &o(what an honor)
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2948: The &6Sophisticated Backpack&r offers impressive portable storage space, making it an invaluable addition to your adventuring toolkit!

ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest2996: The Iron Paraglider (and all other upgraded Paragliders) boost your durability greatly!
&eTip:&r Paragliders can also be enchanted with &dUnbreaking&r or &dMending!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest3108: Using &eThe Sandwiching Station&r you can create a custom modular sandwich!

It needs to be &eSliced Bread&r! Then place as many fillings as you want, place another slice of bread on the very top to finish! Break the sandwich and you've just done it!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest3326: The Nature's Compass allows you to locate the biome of your dreams!
Simply Right-Click and press Find Biome! Make sure you select a biome native to the dimension you are in!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest3356: If you want to ensure you arrive on time, you'll likely want to invest in a &eCopper Upgrade&r
This item can be combined with your glider of choice in an anvil to protect it during bad weather!

"Your clothes are so clean they look new... And there's a vaguely floral smell about them..."

&6&lWARNING:&r&r If you are about to craft this &espellbook&r, &4&lDO NOT DO IT&r&r until you take all your precious &espells&r out. If you don't, they will be gone and become part of a rats nest. &nNot kidding&r. I learned that the hard way. Twice... T_T
The &eArcane Anvil&r has a few uses:

First of all it let's you level up your spells with higher rarity &eink&r. Usually it's cheaper to make a higher level version with the &eSpell Forge&r but certain spell can only get to their highest potential this way.
The &eArcane Anvil&r also allows you to imbue one spell into a sword, helmet, or chestplate. Essentially you are getting +1 spell slot while holding/wearing said item.

The final function is to apply &eupgrade orbs&r to armor pieces, staves, and spellbooks. You can apply up to 3 &eupgrade orbs&r per item. These upgrade orbs can grant all sorts of bonuses like spell power, cooldown reduction, maximum mana, cast time speed, etc...
For those looking to be a jack-of-all-trades... or some extra defense

Whether you like it or not, this &eRuined Book&r holds immerse dormant power and you'll have to delve deep into the &7Ancient Cities&r if you wish to procure one for yourself. It's far too damaged to be used as is, so you might need a few more materials to make it into something usable.
Most of these &ecurios&r can be looted from chests or crafted.
"I don't care how big the room is... I cast FIREBALL!"
"I put on my robe and wizard hat"
Hopefully you can find a &2captured Wandering Trader&r by the &cEvoker&r who can translate their &eresearch journal&r.
(Low chance to spawn in each &7Evoker's Fort&r)
Have some emeralds ready... it won't be cheap

So a little &2Rat friend&r told me the &4Dead King's&r lair has plenty of magical resources (&einks&r, &earcane essence&r, &eblank runes&r, etc...) that could be worth exploring even if you aren't fighting the &4Dead King&r.
Why struggle when you can go to the source?
All spells scale with your spell power, generic or class specific.
However, there's a few spells that also base their power of your current held weapon.
Those would be &eDivine Strike&r and &eFlaming Strike&r. A berserker's best friend.
Hmm... I think I suddenly need a BIG scythe
You can apply &eup to three orbs&r per piece of valid equipment (each armor piece, weapon, staff, spellbook). You'll an &eArcane Anvil&r to apply said orbs.
Inventory clogged with extra spells you'll never use?
Say no more. This &ecauldron&r allows you to destroy the worthless spells and (sometimes) get &eink&r in return.
Additionally, you can brew &epotions&r and even combine &eink&r from a rarity to get a better rarity one.
Harness the spectral power of Maledictus
Base material for most armor sets and a few other items.
Go inside the Arch &7Evoker's Fort&r, steal their &eResearch Jounal&r.
The &cIllager raids&r are stronger than ever and you can adquiere some of their powers with these brand new &espellbooks&r
Secret item with amazing magical properties as long as you don't mind dealing less damage with regular weapons.
This weapons come with one preset spell
From the &eCataclysm&r mod. Found in the &7Sunken City&r.
Equip a &espellbook&r in your &eSpellbook Curio Slot&r and that will allow you to access your spells with a few &lkeybinds&r.
&o(Personal preference is holding &lX&r to open the spell selection wheel and pressing &lR&r to cast the selected spell. You can also assign keybinds directly to a spell slot.)&r
Alright! You are getting the hang of spellcasting but it's kinda sad if you only prepare a few spells in your &espellbook.&r Let's look into some options.
Improve any &espellbook&r with less than 12 slots &eup to 12 slots&r. It's like teaching a new trick to an old dog.
You'll need an arcane anvil to apply these to your spellbooks
ftbquests.chapter.little_logistics.quest: This block emits a redstone signal from the back when it detects a vehicle, will display range when right-clicked.
A basic tugboat that can operate on any furnace fuel. Fuel can be loaded with hoppers placed on top of tug docks.
Same as vanilla hopper, but 8 times as fast!
Use this barge to transport fluids, can be loaded and unloaded with a Fluid Hoppers.
Place under a block of water, works similar to vanilla powered rail. Can be used to force the tug to take a specific route.
Does not affect barges. Shift-right-click to rotate.

Performs fishing passively, uses vanilla fishing rod loot table. Needs to be in open water for nets to be deployed. Can be unloaded with hoppers and barge docks. Must be docked and part of a tug-train to interface with hoppers.
The barge has shallow water and ‚Äúoverfishing‚Äù penalties, so it‚Äôs best to use this barge on long routes into oceans.
The yield is maximised when the water is 20 or more blocks deep. Overfishing is tracked per barge and per block, routes 200 or more blocks long should be sufficient to avoid overfishing.
&6Hint:&r Autofishing will not enable you to gather the special bonus treasure from fishing by hand!
A basic Steam Locomotive that can operate on any furnace fuel. Fuel can be loaded with hoppers!
A hopper but for fluids, can import from the top and export from the sides. Can be loaded by right-clicking with buckets. Can be used to load/unload vessels using Docks.
Train cars are similar to vanilla minecarts, but can be linked to a locomotive and docked.
Vehicles can be linked using ‚Äúvehicle chains‚Äù. Train and Tug/Barge orientation will be updated automatically!
This item stores a route for the vehicle's.

When the item is placed in the vehicle's route slot, the vehicle will follow the route in order from node 0. Right click at any coordinate to add a node to the back of the tug route (cannot add to the middle). Right click at the location of any existing node to remove it. Shift right click to bring up the menu that lets you modify the order of nodes or rename them. The route can be copied by placing it together with an empty one in a crafting grid.
Automatically collects items in a radius! Connect a Chest Barge behind the Item Collection Barge as the Item Collection Barge does not provide an iventory of its own!
Held in hand, the Conductor's Wrench will display the locations of currently registered locomotives and tugs. Right clicking any rails will cycle it through its various shapes!
A simple barge that seats one player.
A simple barge that holds items, very similar to vanilla minecart. Must be docked and part of a tug-train to interface with hoppers.

Trains can be docked using a combination of ‚Äúlocomotive docking rails‚Äù and ‚Äútrain car docking rails‚Äù. Line the docking rails up, place unloaders below the rails and loaders on either side. Blue mode is used to unload and orange to load.

The rails will automatically tell the locomotive to wait as long as there‚Äôs anything to be moved, if a redstone signal is applied to the locomotive rail, the locomotive will keep waiting regardless.
Craft some Locomotive and Train Car Docking Rails
&6&lLittle Logistics&r is a mod focused on efficient, affordable and long-distance transport!
Using fun little vehicles such as trains and boats, you can improve your logistics in a cute and effective way!
Same as vanilla chest minecart, can be loaded or unloaded using vanilla hoppers or rapid hoppers from this mod.

A locomotive powered by Forge Energy, can be charged when docked with a Vehicle Charger. The locomotive has an extra slot for a capacitor, this is useful if the locomotive ran out of energy mid-way and needs to be recharged.
There are two types of vessels in this mod: tugs and barges. Tugs can move the barges when chained, and barges and do all sort of stuff. Tugs can also be moved manually using leads.
A Little Tug Goes a Long Way
Can transport fluids, can be loaded or unloaded using fluid hoppers.
Craft a Fluid Tank Train Car

Assists vessels around sharp corners, should always be used on sharp corners or near entrances to narrow waterways (such as those for docks). Affects both tugs and barges. Shift-right-click to flip direction.
Must not have a full solid block directly on top (i.e. no stone, planks etc. fence posts, signs etc. OK).
Craft a Vessel Corner Guide Rail
Locomotives have built-in collision detection that is designed for junctions. Locomotives AI will automatically decide and give priority to avoid a collision.
Locomotives will automatically control their speed on rails. They will travel faster on long stretches of straight tracks, but slow down as they approach docks, junctions, or corners.

A tugboat powered by Forge Energy, can be charged when docked with a Vehicle Charger. The tug has an extra slot for a capacitor, this is useful if the tug ran out of energy mid-way and needs to be recharged.
Standard Switch and T-junction tracks can be switched using redstone. Powered rails work great when trying to make loops.
Switch rails switch between straight or left/right when powered by a redstone signal!
Craft some Junction and Switch Rails
A charger for Energy Tug or Locomotive, connect to any forge energy cable to add power to the charger. Place on top of a dock or beside a rail to charge the vehicle when docking.

There are two dock blocks: barge and tug. The tug block must always be present for the barge docks to work. The top texture of the tug dock must be aligned with the barge docks, you can shift right-click the tug dock to flip the dock direction.

The barge docks must form a straight line from the tug dock, there shouldn‚Äôt be any gaps in the line. The tug dock can only insert into the tug (orange/output mode), place a hopper on top of the dock to extract. The barge docks can both insert (orange/output mode) and extract (blue/input mode) into/from the barges, shift-right click to switch the mode.
Place a hopper below the waterblock next to the barge dock to extract. The dock line should be next to a 1 block wide canal, wider canals can prevent the vessels from docking properly.
Craft a Tug and Barge Dock

Automatic switch tracks will be switched by a locomotive with a route. Every time a locomotive approaches an automatic junction, it will look for the closest waypoint it is yet to visit, and switch the track accordingly.
Waypoint can be configured using the ‚Äúlocomotive route‚Äù item, they are not ordered.

ftbquests.chapter.mayor_position_availab: In order to keep your villagers happy, you will need to construct them homes, build a level 1 house for a villager to live in!

&eTip:&r Upgrading a the level of a &eHouse&r will increase the amount of villagers that can live under its roof, before you know it you will be charging 1500 emeralds a month for a bedroom in shared accommodation. &oCapitalism Woo!

The next major thing you need for your colony is food. The fastest way to get food is to build a Fisher‚Äôs Hut. You could build a Farm or one of the animal herders, but a Fisher is faster. Building a Restaurant may also be advisable if you don‚Äôt want to feed your colonists (or cook their food) by hand.

&oAt this point, you might be tired of bringing all of the resources to the Builder and taking them from the Fisher, Forester, Miner, etc. You also might want to store items in one place. Well, the Warehouse and Courier‚Äôs Hut are the solution you are looking for! Couriers transport items between the Warehouse and all of the workplaces.
Once you have chosen a location for your colony, you must place a Supply Ship or Supply Camp.
You can only place one of these per world. The Supply Camp/Ship gives you the Town Hall block you need to officially start your colony.

They also have some other supplies you may need during the building of your colony. Once you have the Town Hall block and the build tool, the remaining camp/ship is just decoration. You can leave it or tear it down.
&eTip;&r Now you can begin upgrading other buildings!
&oIf your style is wood, it‚Äôs recommended to build a Forester‚Äôs Hut next. That way your new Forester can start gathering wood for your next builds and for tools and other items.

Your colonists will need a place to sleep and a house, so it is recommended to build a Tavern next. The Tavern also allows visitors to come to your colony, and you can recruit them to stay as citizens.

The Town Hall block is what actually creates the colony. It also functions as the center of it. This is where you start using the build tool to place buildings. Using the build tool ensures you can see exactly where the building will be, which direction it will face, and if it is at the right Y level (some buildings need to be raised to the correct Y level).Once the Town Hall block is placed, you will start receiving your initial 4 citizens.

&oThis is where you need to decide what you need next, based on how you play and what your colony needs. But you have several things to look at. Once you get seven citizens you can get attacked by raiders and you may want to build a Guard Tower, or you may get a sick citizen and want to build a Hospital, or you may decide you want a Sawmill to make the needed items for a worker. Or you may just want to have a specific worker, or you found a great place for a certain hut. &nYou decide how your colony will grow!
The Restaurant can employ one citizen as a Chef, he can prepare food and serve other citizens!

&oThis is where you need to decide what you need next, based on how you play and what your colony needs. But you have several things to look at. Once you get seven citizens you can get attacked by raiders and you may want to build a Guard Tower, or you may get a sick citizen and want to build a Hospital, or you may decide you want a Sawmill to make the needed items for a worker. Or you may just want to have a specific worker, or you found a great place for a certain hut. &nYou decide how your colony will grow!
&oStone and ores are another major need for any colony, so a Mine is the next logical step, rarely a miner can mine rare treasure from stone!

&oAt this point, you might be tired of bringing all of the resources to the Builder and taking them from the Fisher, Forester, Miner, etc. You also might want to store items in one place. Well, the Warehouse and Courier‚Äôs Hut are the solution you are looking for! Couriers transport items between the Warehouse and all of the workplaces.

The next major thing you need for your colony is food. The fastest way to get food is to build a Fisher‚Äôs Hut. You could build a Farm or one of the animal herders, but a Fisher is faster. Building a Restaurant may also be advisable if you don‚Äôt want to feed your colonists (or cook their food) by hand.

&oThis is where you need to decide what you need next, based on how you play and what your colony needs. But you have several things to look at. Once you get seven citizens you can get attacked by raiders and you may want to build a Guard Tower, or you may get a sick citizen and want to build a Hospital, or you may decide you want a Sawmill to make the needed items for a worker. Or you may just want to have a specific worker, or you found a great place for a certain hut. &nYou decide how your colony will grow!
Once you have chosen a location for your colony, you must place a Supply Ship or Supply Camp.
You can only place one of these per world. The Supply Camp/Ship gives you the Town Hall block you need to officially start your colony.

They also have some other supplies you may need during the building of your colony. Once you have the Town Hall block and the build tool, the remaining camp/ship is just decoration. You can leave it or tear it down.
&eTip:&r You will need to keep your builder well fed during construction, make sure to place food in their inventory!

&6Note: &rBefore anything can be built, you need a Builder. The Builder must build their own Builder‚Äôs Hut before building any other structures, and they cannot build or upgrade a hut to a higher level than their own hut level.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest10126018: Mekanism's Bio Fuel is an easy-to-obtain, early source of energy made from plant life. Any plant matter can be used as Bio Fuel, from seeds to pumpkins and melons - making it a renewable resource. Creating Bio Fuel is as easy as putting plant life into a powered Crusher. Use it in a Bio-Generator for energy or in the Pressurized Reaction Chamber to create Ethylene.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest14332341: Osmium can only be found in &eThe Great Below!
The Start of Your Mekanism Journey!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest17120581: Free Runners are the perfect way to get around those pesky 1-block inclines! No more fall damage, either - as long as they're charged, of course. A fall will reduce the charge, depending on how far it was.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest18713119: The Nutritional Liquifier is the perfect way to turn those pesky consumable food items into delicious Nutritional Paste! Just pop it into the left UI slot, and watch the magic happen. It can hold a total of 10000mB of paste before it is full and halts production, so you can always be sure you've got a tasty treat on hand. The nutritional paste is used by the MekaSuit Helmet and the Canteen for feeding the player without having to carry physical individual food items in their inventory, so you can rest assured you'll never go hungry again!
A Balanced Diet in a Can; Now Soylent-Free!*
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest38958610: Looking for an all-in-one tool that does the work of a pickaxe, axe, and shovel? Look no further than Mekanism's Atomic Disassembler! This electronic paxel has five settings that can be cycled through by crouching and scrolling your mouse's scroll wheel or using the Item mode switch keybind, making it the perfect tool for any job. Plus, it's a great weapon against mobs!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest41142483: The Metallurgic Infuser will be one of your most used machines when playing with Mekanism. It will be needed to create Steel Ingots, various Infused Alloys, and various Circuits. All of these are necessary if you want to progress in Mekanism.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest42973327: Mekanism's Configurator is the perfect tool for customizing your machines. With several modes to choose from, you can customize your machines to your heart's content. The Configurator comes with four modes: Configurate, Empty, Rotate, and Wrench.
You can easily switch between modes by crouching and scrolling up or down with your mouse's scroll wheel.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest70148307: The Enrichment Chamber is a machine that uses energy to extract dusts out of certain blocks and ores, making it essential to multiply your ingot production. Not to be mistaken with the Crusher, this machine is the pulverizer equivalent in other mods.
The Enrichment Chamber can also be used to turn various resources into their refined variants, all to improve the efficiency of the Metallurgic Infuser.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest71015759: The Flamethrower is a ranged weapon which uses Hydrogen gas as its fuel. It's great for barbecuing mobs - just make sure to get them nice and crispy! It's most effective on large groups of mobs, where the user can hose down the entire group with fuel at a short distance.
The Best Way to Light Up Your Life!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest74243419: The Scuba Tank is a great way to extend your stay underwater- just make sure you have a full tank of oxygen and your Gas Mask on and you're good to go!
Dive Into the Deep End With Top-Of-The-Line Scuba Gear!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest75414362: The Jetpack is perfect for those who want to take to the skies! It uses Hydrogen gas as a fuel and can store up to 24,000 mB. Depending on your needs, you can toggle between three modes--Regular, Hover, and Disabled--. Plus, it displays the Hydrogen remaining and the mode active in the bottom left corner. So take flight today with the Jetpack!
The Future of Flying Is Here!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest80849699: Did you know that the Jetpack can't be worn with chestplate armor? Well, now you do! But don't worry, you can upgrade to the Armored Jetpack if you want protection. Plus, when used with a pair of Free Runners, you safely disable it without worrying about fall damage!
The Next Level in Personal Security!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest81801908: This electric bow is perfect for those who want to add a little zing to their arrows.
The Perfect Way to Shoot Arrows Without All That Pesky Manual Labor!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest86694902: The Anchor Upgrade is a machine upgrade which keeps the chunk of the machine to which it is applied loaded. This is helpful for machines like the Digital Miner and Teleporter Portal which must be in loaded chunks to function properly.
Only the Digital Miner, Teleporter Portal and the Quantum Entangloporter can have the Anchor Upgrade installed.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.title: &7Mekanism (I)
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest1636486434: &oTools made from Netherite have incredible durability and mining speed. Netherite Pickaxe's are also immune to fire!
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest2823051759: &eThe Mining Gadget &ris a device that shoots a continuous high-powered beam of pure energy.
This beam is capable of mining blocks at high speed and can be upgraded with many different upgrades for different playstyles and preferences!
&6Hint:&r You can upgrade your Mining Gadget with a &eModification Station
&eTip:&r This item needs to be charged with &d"FE - Forge Energy"&r
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest4156035262: &eTip:&r Tools enchanted with Vein Miner will be able to excavate! You can craft Amethyst Tools which come pre-enchanted!
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest4971210052: &eAlex's Caves&r is a mod that adds a handful of &6Rare&r and Expansive &dUnderground Biomes&r, each with a swath of unique content associated with them.

You might have taken note of the fact that they're &6Rare&r though, and you might be thinking "&7&ooh great, that'll be fun to try and find...&r", and you'd be right! Fortunately, the mod has mechanics to locate them!
And before you think about using some kind of &2Biome Locator&r to find them, don't, it won't work. &eAlex's Caves&r wants you to &dinteract with its own mechanics&r, not just skip over them.
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest6409845484: In order to &oactually&r find one of &eAlex's Caves&r without losing your mind, you'll need to decode your &dCave Tablets&r at the &bSpelunkery Table&r.
Decoding them is as simple as &dfinding key words shown on the left&r in the batch of &eGalactic Standard Alphabet&r text on the right.

Do it 3 times without more than 5 wrong guesses, and you'll get a &6Cave Codex&r, which you can &buse to craft a &6Cave Map&r for the type of cave the Codex is related to, or &duse while holding with &l{key.use}&r to add information about some of that Cave's features to the &bCave Compendium&r when you read it.
&eTip:&r Memorize the appearance of &aVowels&r in &eGalactic Standard Alphabet&r, being common characters, knowing the way they look helps in easing the process!
You &ocould&r also just use the collective memory known as "&dThe Internet&r", surely someone's made a translator out there. But where's the fun in that?
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest6410433765: &oIt's deep underground! Not quite past the bedrock, but don't dig straight down, you'll regret that!
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest8033327730: The &eTunnel Digger&r can be used to quickly clear out a mineshaft or tunnel.
It will dig in a 1x3 radius but only when fueled and used by a Player!
Additionally you can aquire &dAmethyst&r to increase the speed of your &eTunnel Digger!&r
You can also use different &eDrill Upgrades&r to increase your efficiency!
&eTip:&r Holding &eSHIFT&r will dig 1 Block below you too!
ftbquests.chapter.mining.title: &7Intro To Mining
ftbquests.chapter.occultism.quest1077895: &7Summons a &5Possessed Elder Guardian&7 that drops &62‚Äì4 Nautilus Shells&7 and has a &640%% chance&7 to drop a &1Heart of the Sea&7.
ftbquests.chapter.occultism.quest1220691: &7To begin, toss a few &2Oak Saplings &7into your &5Spirit Fire&7 ‚Äî it might be wise to add several for future use.
&7Next, plant them and patiently wait for them to grow. They may appear ordinary, but to the spirits, they are &dmysterious &7and &dimportant&7.
&7Once they have matured, eat one of your &dDream Fruits&7 to glimpse what the spirits see.
&7After your vision changes, gather the &6logs&7 and return...
&7But try not to bring back any... &4<shake>‚Äòfriends‚Äô&7. That would be... undesirable. At least, for now.
ftbquests.chapter.occultism.quest1713213: &7You can even control the &etime of day &7by summoning &6Rituals&7!
A Shift In The World Rotation
ftbquests.chapter.occultism.quest1840050: &7To craft your very own &fChalk&7, place both &6Otherworld Wood &7and &6Otherstone &7into a &6Furnace&7.
&7Burn them to create &cOtherworld Ash&7 and &cBurnt Otherstone&7, then combine them in a &6Crafting Table&7 to make some &fChalk&7!
&7Unfortunately... you didn‚Äôt do a very good job. &7Humans never do.
&7Come on, hand it over ‚Äî toss it into your &5Spirit Fire&7 and I‚Äôll clean it for you.
ftbquests.chapter.occultism.quest1958989: &7Did you know your &6Crusher &7can increase ore yields?
&7You‚Äôll get even more if the ores were mined with &bSilk Touch&7!
ftbquests.chapter.occultism.quest2036973: &7Repairs equipment while mining and &aupgrades other Familiars&7.

ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest106047237: The Magmatic Dynamo is an even greater power source! Feed it hot liquids to produce &eRedstone Flux(RF)/Forge Energy(FE)!&r
Energy is only output from a dynamo &nwhile it is running.&r A dynamo MUST be running for energy to be output.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest111977660: Can be used on machines to increase RF capacity and RF transfer speeds!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest114752939: Increases the liquid capacity of machines, dynamos, and equipment!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest124707760: Allows the configuration of machines or equipment to accept or deny specific items!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest127903957: Uses mBs of potions to tip arrows automatically! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest132262837: Have a lot of machines that need configured to the same settings? Look no further: the Redprint is here!

To bind the Redprint to the proper settings, hold it in your hand and open a configured machine (If you need to reset the Redprint then shift+right-click in the air). Next, right click any other machine and all of the redstone, transfer, and side configurations with be pasted!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest137906081: Servos are used to pull liquids from attached inventories into fluiducts! Comes with a filter and redstone control!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest145277220: Reduces processing speed, but increases RF efficiency!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest156013375: Uses water to speed up crop growth in an area! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest167497670: Increases processing speed, but reduces RF efficiency!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest173418724: Prevents wasting fuel when internal energy buffer is full!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest186163391: The Centrifugal Separator is most notably used for the production of bitumen from bituminous sand, but also has a few extra features!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest193494093: Redstone Flux Cells can store large amounts of power. Redstone Flux Cells can be upgraded to store even more with &eIntegral Components!&r
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest213420455: The Induction Smelter is a useful way to &nmake alloys and smelt resources&r!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest232502217: The Tinker's Workbench allows you to add upgrades to your &eThermal Series equipment&r to make them better!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest242544718: Can be used on machines to increase RF capacity and RF transfer speeds!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest265130425: The Crescent Hammer is a necessary tool for any aspiring engineer! It allows easy rotation of machines with a simple right-click!
The Crescent Hammer can also remove the connection between two or more ducts! Ever wanted two duct lines next to each other? Now you can! This even works with several other mods like EnderIO!
You can even pick up machines and other storage devices with shift+right-click! Using this method will retain the items/liquids/power inside of the machine/storage.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest287554824: Collects experience from machine operations or the world! Base capacity is 2.5k, but can be increased with Integral Components.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest288321513: Increases the chance of secondary drops from being produced, but increases the processing cost!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest304177474: The Stirling Dynamo is a great early game power source! Feed it any burnable items to produce &eRedstone Flux(RF)/Forge Energy(FE)!&r
Energy is only output from a dynamo &nwhile it is running.&r A dynamo MUST be running for energy to be output.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest331126509: Increase the range of machines and equipment by an additional block in all directions!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest368629217: Auto-Input and Auto-Output control the behavior of how the machine's faces interact with the adjacent blocks.

Auto-Input will pull from the adjacent blocks on the sides set to input. This means that if there is a chest on a face that is set to input with Auto-Input on, the machine will automactically bring the contents from the chest into the machine.
Auto-Output works the same as Auto-Input. However, it pushes resources from the internal output slot into the inventories of adjacent blocks instead of pulling.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest375545516: Uses power to pull in items from far away! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest376562892: Items in the output slot will go back to the input slot for another processing cycle!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest390837390: Uses less of a catalyst for an operation, but increases energy cost!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest422029749: Have extra food that needs to go? Say hello to the Gourmand Dynamo! Feed it any item with saturation bars to produce &eRedstone Flux(RF)/Forge Energy(FE)!&r
Energy is only output from a dynamo &nwhile it is running.&r A dynamo MUST be running for energy to be output.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest424005624: Uses mBs of potions to automatically give potion effects to you or other entities! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest446082817: Can be used on machines to increase RF capacity and RF transfer speeds!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest485437682: The Energetic Infuser is a great way to charge any piece of equipment that needs power!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest503281753: The Satchel is a simple way to store your items!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest523507493: Doubles the RF/t but lowers the fuel efficiency!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest528307592: Increases the base operation speed, RF use, RF storage, and RF transfer rate by 3x.
Only the highest tier Integral Component increases these stats!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest533072952: Safely detonate any explosive from a distance! Onlookers will never know it was you!
&o&5AdamCo‚Ñ¢ is not responsible for any home damages caused by detonations of explosives...&r
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest548105585: Increases the base operation speed, RF use, RF storage, and RF transfer rate by 2x.
Only the highest tier Integral Component increases these stats!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest553338331: Using the sawdust from the sawmill, we can fashion a <rainb>Carboard Box!&r
You can use it on any block(unless the block is blacklisted) to preserve the data of the block as you transport it.
You can easily move spawners this way!
Right click on a block to wrap it with the Cardboard Box. Then, you can break it and transport it anywhere you like. Once you placed it back down, just shift+right click to remove the Cardboard Box.
Think of all the breakable things you could preserve!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest582622107: Uses power to mine blocks! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest583821236: Stores large amounts of liquid! The Resevoir can be used to automatically fill equipment, or act as a large bucket for recipes and in-world interactions! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest593329030: Turbo-Servos work over 20 times faster than normal Servos. However, it has less filtering functionality.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest594294649: The Redstone Furnace works exactly like a normal furnace but is &nfaster and only requires power to smelt&r!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest604446464: You can further increase your Pulverizer yield by putting a Catalyst in the slot below the item you are pulverizing. &eFlint&r and &eBasalz Powder &rwork as Catalysts!
Increase your ore yield with the Pulverizer!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest626843048: Fluid Cells can store large amounts of liquids. Fluid Cells can be upgraded to store even more with &eIntegral Components!&r
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest638672258: Uses power to chop wood! Can be upgraded with augments!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest656366589: Allows the configuration of machines or equipment to accept or deny specific liquids!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest668382494: The Multiservo Press can be used to &ncraft gears, plates, coins, and to pack/unpack resources into their compressed/uncompressed forms&r.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest674777287: The Blast Chiller can be used to turn molten liquids into their solid forms!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest690088790: The Holding enchant will increase the storage capacity of most Thermal Series gear. Try it out!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest701847752: Increases the base operation speed, RF use, RF storage, and RF transfer rate by 4x.
Only the highest tier Integral Component increases these stats!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest707753979: Fluiducts can be used to transport fluids! Fluiducts automatically input into attached inventories, but they require a &eServo&r to pull!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest726163314: The Sawmill will give &n6 planks per log, instead of just 4&r!
It also generates sawdust as a byproduct, which can be useful for many things, including the <rainb>Legendary Cardboard Box&r!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest728363723: Melt with the Magma Crucible, and bottle with the Fluid Encapsulator!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest747248855: Doubles the duration of potion effects!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest768042108: The &eMachine Frame&r is the basis of all machines in the &5Thermal Series&r, so you may want to stock up!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest779203501: The Pulverizer can be used to &nincrease the amount of resources&r obtained from ores and more!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest808118796: There are no itemducts in the current version of Thermal Dynamics. You will have to use alternatives for item transfer.
Enderio item conduits, Integrated Dynamics/Tunnels cables, and Mekanism logistical transporters are all good alternatives!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest817816470: Smelt your increased yield in the Redstone Furnace!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest823181053: Filters can be used to allow different fluids to go in different directions in a fluiduct system.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest826544102: The Magma Crucible is great at melting things!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest835377851: Voids excess secondary drops from the output of a machine.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest876821367: Every face(except the front on some machines) can be configured for inputs and outputs! Open up the "Configure" panel inside a Thermal Series machine to configure the faces.
Blue is for input. Orange is for output.
The center panel is the front face.
The bottom left panel is the back face.
The top/bottom and left/right panels around the center panel control the top/bottom and left/right faces respectively.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest882880105: Increases the level of a potion effect, but at the cost of duration!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest891888399: Fluxducts can be used to transport power. Fluxducts automatically pull energy from dynamos and push energy into machines.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest898308539: The Fluid Encapsulator &ncombines fluids with blocks and items&r! You can make several interesting recipes this way and can even &nfill buckets and bottles automatically&r!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest906727030: Redstone Flux Limiters can be attached to fluxducts to limit the transfer of energy!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest968239353: Stores power to automatically recharge other equipment! Can be upgraded with augments!

ftbquests.chapter.vampires_cookbook.ques: These recipes require both Blood Syrup and ingredients from the Vampire Forest
Mixed Recipes

Craft the Bloody Dark Stone Bricks and then place them on the ground around a 2x2 hole as shown in the image below.  Right click on the portal with a bottle of Vampire Blood (kill vampires with a stake) to activate.
{image:modpack:textures/vampire_forest_portal.png width:100 height:100 align:center fit:true}
Vampire Forest Dimension
If your crosshair turns into vampire fangs when hovering over an entity,
you can hold the Vampirism "&l{keys.vampirism.suck}&r" key (default V) to suck their blood.
If your blood bar is full and you have a bottle, it will start filling up the bottle.
Once the eyes turn from yellow to red, the bottle is full.
(If you have a mulitiple vanilla bottles, there will sometimes be odd behavior when filling,
where it will fill a bunch of bottles a little bit instead of filling up one at a time.
This can usually be fixed by holding one of the blood bottles and it will start filling them
up correctly. It might not be filling the one you are holding but should be going into one of them)
Blood Bottle (Filled)
Blood Bottle
Don't right click the orchids!  The "right click to harvest" doesn't give you anything. You need to break them to pick them up.
Orchid Recipes
Kill a Villager or Hunter with a Farmer's Delight Knife to get eyes.
Human Eye
Any Farmer's Delight Knife
Human Eye Recipes
Use full blood bottles to make Blood Syrup (the eyes on the bottle will turn from red to yellow) which is the base for all of these recipes.
Blood Syrup Recipes
Get Pure Blood by killing Vampire Barons in the Vampire Forest.
Use a bowl on placed Weird Jelly to eat it.  Gives the sunscreen buff!
Any Pure Blood
Pure Blood Recipes
&eUnlock Title:&r Vampire Gourmand
Cooked all Recipes!
Chop the Orchid on a cutting board to get petals and seeds.
Hoe some Cursed Dirt to plant the orchid seeds.
All of the food in this chapter can fill your blood bar.
You can bonemeal the black mushrooms to make a giant version.
Black Mushroom Recipes

Put raw meat (multiple vanilla and modded meats work) or human hearts into a Blood Grinder to make impure blood.  Put it through a Blood Seive to purify it.  They can pull from tanks/inventories above them so it can be combined in this arrangement for automation.  Right with a bottle to get the blood out.
{image:modpack:textures/autoblood.png width:462 height:624 align:center fit:true}
For Vampire Minions who can't suck blood.
Blood from Meat
You can still eat normal foods to get extra hearts!
Tip!
ftbquests.chapter.vampirism__hunter.ques: Go inside the trainers house and use the special chair inside to inject your that garlic vaccination. It will make you immune to the Vampire's poisonous "Sanguinare Vampiris" bite.This is more or less the only advantage that you will have at that level. But you can train yourself to become stronger and learn some useful skills.
To become a Vampire Hunter you will need to right-click a Garlic Injection on a Injection Chair
